3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
41.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2018
Un juego de rol de la vieja escuela, pero de la vieja vieja, de cuando no tenias ni mapas en los juegos.
El juego esta dividido en pisos y siempre puedes volver al piso anterior (por si te has quedado algun secreto por descubrir) y basicamente consiste en su mayor parte ir resolviendo los distintos puzzles para avanzar y ♥♥♥ combates de cuadricula. Vamos por partes:
- Puzzles, tienes una gran variedad de puzzles y muchos a resolver. Si eres de los que no usan guias, hay pergaminos y señales en las paredes ♥♥♥ algunas pistas. La verdad es que este es su punto fuerte ya que son de una gran variedad y ♥♥♥ muchos elementos distintos como botones, palancas, placas de presion, etc.
- Secretos tiene bastantes (71) y la mayoria son de activar un pequeño boton aunque habra otros ♥♥♥ otras mecanicas como combinacion de palancas o de placas de presion.
- Combate por cuadricula, este es el punto mas flojo. El combate por cuadricula es basicamente que te puedes mover en vertical y horizontal y basicamente consiste en situarte en un lado del enemigo mientras el mira en otra direccion y pegarle en ese momento, usando el strafe mucho para ayudar a moverse y girar continuamente. Esto no esta mal como guiño a los antiguos juegos en los que se basa, el problema que tiene es basicamente que ♥♥♥ este movimiento practicamente acabaras ♥♥♥ el 80% o 90% de los enemigos, es decir, un combate muy simple, ademas de que el balanceo entre personajes no esta muy pulido del todo.
-Magia. Esto si es original en la ejecucion pero no se hasta que cierto punto a la gente le gustara. En cualquier juego tu pulsas el boton del hechizo y se lanza, aqui tienes que seleccionar las runas del hechizo para poder lanzarlo y todo en tiempo real, el juego no se para, mientras abres el compendio, seleccionas por ejemplo una runa de fuego que corresponde al hechizo basico de fuego, y la lanzas, el enemigo te estara golpeando. Esto te lleva a que no sea muy recomendable el uso de mas de 1 mago en el grupo.
- Historia. Aunque tiene sus momentos buenos, en mi opinion el final fue cuanto menos cuestionable por decirlo de alguna manera.
- Se echa en falta algunos jefes mas.

Si te gusto la saga Eye of beholder (hay que tener muchos años en la mochila), ni lo pienses, compralo. Ahora, si nunca has jugado este tipo de juegos, echa un vistazo en youtube a algun video antes de comprarlo porque no a todo el mundo le va a gustar y ten mucho en cuenta que este juego es mas de resolver los puzzles que el combate en si.
Ahora bien, jugar el juego en modo old school es un golpe de aire fresco en estos tiempos.

Como nota, un 7,5/10, le pondria mas debido a los puzzles que tiene pero creo que el combate le podrian haber mejorado bastante
 
pedro
458 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
46.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2019
Просто. Сложно. Изящно. Умно.

...Пока идет загрузка Legend of Grimrock 2, есть несколько минут для того, чтоб выразить скудным набором слов те несколько часов обыкновенного геймерского счастья, которое подарил мне герой этого обзора - Legend of Grimrock .

Честно говоря, не ожидал я, что в 2019 году от ролевой игры мой усталый мозг отхватит такую неслабую дозу эндорфина. Захотелось поиграть в РПГ... Открыл библиотеку игр... Глаза бежали вниз по списку, не вызывая у сознания ни малейшего отклика... Навскидку ткнул в LoG... Да, я знал, что у этой игры масса хвалебных отзывов, но сведения о самой игре ограничивались лишь жанром - dungeon crawl. Что, дескать, это дань традиции - эпохе РПГ 80-90х годов а-ля Might and Magiс, Eye of Beholder или Wizardry. Ни в одну из перечисленных игр раньше не играл (хотя годков-то уже мне немало, да...), кроме нежно мною любимой, исхоженной вдоль и поперек Wizardry 8. Скриншоты игры мало прояснили ситуацию. Подумал, что это будет наподобие той же Визардри... Ох, как ошибался!

Запускаем LoG, и сразу - игра контрастов... Бравурная мелодия главного меню, обещающая эпичное приключение на фоне темного квадрата дверного проема в подземелье... Хм-хм... Новая игра... Генерация партии не вызвала особых вопросов: обычные РПГшные расы и классы, с обычным наборов статов, скиллов и перков... А, ладно - возьму лучше заранее сгенерированную партию, по ходу дела разберемся... Начать игру. И... Что это? Статичные картинки вместо интро, несколько слов сюжетной фабулы (преступников бросили в недра горы на испытание - ах, как это оригинально...), и вот наша партия оказывается в стартовой локации... Пробую управление... Ха-ха, так вот как оно было раньше - ходим строго по квадратикам!.. О, а что это на стене, подозрительно похожее на кнопочку? Да, так и есть! Что ж, теперь придется смотреть в оба... О нет, блуждания по километрам узких коридоров, обтянутых одной и той же текстурой, под звуки хорошего эмбиента... О, первый враг - гигансткая улитка... Хм, а сражения-то здесь реалтаймовые, забудь про Визардри уже окончательно... Первая загадка с сапфирами... А тут нужно кинуть камушек на платформу... Первая открытая Iron door... Да, вроде ничего сложного, довольно просто. Идем дальше, посмотрим на второй уровень...

И вот где-то там, после окончания второго уровня начинает, в мозгу начинает зарождаться то, что к пятому уровню расцветает пышным цветом. Это нечто я назову кайфом. Простым (а местами - прямо таки примитивным), но все таки сложным, местами изящным и неизменно - умным.

Хотя казалось бы, ну что в ней такого? Унылая текстура №1 первую половину игры, унылая текстура №2 - вторую. Простая ролевая система. Практически полное отсутствие сюжета (кроме редких записок нашего заочного друга Торнума, записей на свитках и загадочных снах, в которых разговаривает с нами некто, явно обитающий где-то на нижних уровнях Гримрока). Скудный набор предметов...

Однако, все это отходит на второй план, когда на сцену выходят загадки, которые нужно разгадать, ловушки, которые нужно избежать и секреты, которые с маниакальной страстью хочется отыскать! Чувствуется, что разработчики игры (всего-то три или четыре человека) вложили свою душу в эти три составляющие своей игры - и ни разу не прогадали! Я человек довольно нетерпеливый, и мне нужна динамика... Но странное дело: когда я по 5-10 минут тыкался в разные углы уровня, пытаясь найти способ пройти дальше, у меня не возникало ни капли раздражения. Наоборот, я чувствовал все больший и больший азарт в решении этой задачи. Все загадки завязаны на геометрии уровня и физике передвижения персонажей (и предметов) в пространстве, они на 100% логичны, и я не встретил ни одну, которая бы решалась простым перебором вариантов. Если что-то не получается, то винить остается только себя: свою невнимательность и свой костенеющий ум... А секреты? Да черт возьми, едва ли в какой игре возникает столь страстное желание рыть носом каждую пядь, чтоб найти камушек-переключатель, открывающий доступ к тайнику! Даже бои с врагами начинают доставлять удовольствие, когда приходится играть с ними в "пятнашки" (первые два ядовитых пня вызвали у меня оторопь)...

Hidden gem, как любят многие писать про игры... В отношении LoG этот эпитет подходит на все сто! От игры ничего не ожидаешь, а она тебя медленно, исподволь затягивает своими незримыми щупальцами, и не отпускает до самого конца. А финальный босс - это вообще угар! Я ожидал всякое, но только не ЭТО. Похоже, разработчики не только отдали дань классике, но и сами же над этим поиронизировали.

LoG сурова. Тому игроку, кто не привык решать задачки сложнее "найдите ключ в бочке рядом с таверной", будет очень неуютно. И тем, кто привык, что его заботливо водят по игре от маркера к маркеру. И тем, кто весело привык рубить в капусту драконов по пять штук на завтрак. И тем, кто не в ладах с английским. И тем, кто страдает клаустрофобией... Шутка!

Лично мне не хватило только разнообразия в экипировке, и чисто в графически - в окружении: ползать половину игры по однообразным коридорам - то еще удовольствие. Я понимаю, конечно, что это дань традиции, но все же в 201х году можно было сделать и что-то более приятное. Хмм... Ну и разве что некоторые секреты можно обнаружить только в случае, если накануне тебе приснился вещий сон, ха-ха. За одно прохождение, увы, десять секреток так и остались мною не открытыми. Эх...

...О, а вот и LoG 2 загрузился. Все, некогда мне больше строчить! Посмотрим, исполнит ли мои чаяния вторая часть...
 
AdGamer
0

Recommandé
26.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2016
This game was a total surprise back when I played it.
I love RPGs and Dungeon games, but never played the old school style ones. This was so refreshing from a gameplay perspective, it was one of the coolest games and played it to bits, did not leave and stones unturned, corners checked etc.
From a graphical perspective it's top notch and, along the amazing sound, it create a really intense and immersive atmosphere.
The puzzles were quite well done and the exploration part was amazing. You can feel so satisfied when you manage to find a secret switch, which leads to a secret door, which leads to a secret treasure :)
The only thing lacking might be the story, which is very strait forward, but still... they did surprise me at the end level.
The game kept me playing and wanting to go back until I finished it... and them some, due to fan created levels and possibility to try the game with different classed+increased difficulty (loved the pen&paper map idea).
Definitely a must play for all lovers of Dungeon Exploring Fans.
 
ROPname

0
Non recommandé
14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2014
This game follows in the footsteps of games like Eye of the Beholder, yet gets lost along the way.

Mainly this game is trying to take an RPG and make it a strategy/ puzzle crawler, instead of a dungeon crawler. In order to succeed at this game you can't fight monsters toe to toe. The game seems to be designed in a way that you must exploit the game mechanics (taking a swing at a monster then retreating before it can attack) in order to survive. This combined with constant puzzles instead of exploring, make this game a poor choice for anyone looking for a true RPG dungeon crawler game.

Party creation is also mediocre, with a minimum selection of classes, and non dynamic races. You also only get a 4 person party instead of 6 which also limits experience.

The game also has a combat interface that is clunkier than I remember the Eye of the Beholder games to be. You can equip two weapons on a chanracter, but can't use them at the same time. Also the spell system tried to be inovative with a rune selection process to make spell casting more of a challenge in the heat of battle. However, the spell interface needs to be opened each time and has some issues.

Also food seems to be unevenly distributed in the dungeons, making me wonder if food was initially and after thought of the game, and then made into a major mechanic at the last minute. It seems to be laid out that if you try and 'clean' the dungeon by exploring every inch of a level, your party will starve to death. However since the game is based on puzzles to unlock the next dungeon, complete exploration is usually a must.
 
Tao

Recommandé
22.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2016
Dungeon Crawler etiketi altında bulabileceğiniz en sağlam oyun kendisi. Daha önce bu tür oyunlar hiç oynamamıştım ama gerçek hayattaki masaüstü D&D oynamış biri olarak oynu çok beğendim. Oyundaki her puzzle sizi kafanızı çalıştırmaya zorluyor. Oynun güzelliğide puzzle larda. Bulduğumuz scroll'lar veya duvardaki yazılar ingilizce gerektirse de bazı kelimeler hariç hepsini çıkarabildim.

Oyunda düşmanların çeşitliliği çok fazla değildi biraz spiderlardan illallah ettiysem de düşmanlar çoktu. Silahlar yeterince hoştu zırh setini tamamlamak için verdiğim uğraşlara değdi. :)

Büyüye gelecek olursak oyunda 4 element var ateş,yıldırım,toprak,hava. Yapımcılar büyü konusunda çok da çeşitlilik sağlamamış doğrusu. Mesela elimizde fireball var, bu fireball elimizden ateş topu fırlamasını sağlıyor çarptığı düşmana hasar veriyor. Bunun lightning elementindeki halinde lightning bolt var oda yıldırım oku fırlatıyor. Yani elementten elemente genel olarak benzeyen büyüler var. Tabiki de benzeri olmayan büyülerde var. Spellcraft diye bir skill tree de var onda da büyü kullanma yeteneğimizi geliştiriyoruz.

Son olarak bu tür oyunların her zamanki gibi can alıcı kısmı olan final boss. Hiç ummadığınız bir şey çıkacak sizde benim kadar şaşıracaksınız sadece son bossu görmek için bile oyun oynanmaya değer.

Bunların hepsinin dışında bana göre bu oyun bir efsaneydi. 2. oyna geçmek için can atıyorum.
 
Kutsal Ruh

Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2016
Wenn dir das Review gefallen hat und du weitere tolle Spiele entdecken willst, dann schau dir doch mal meine Kuratorenseite an. Ein Follow würde mich sehr freuen


Legend of Grimrock ist ein klassischer Dungeoncrawler der mit sehr guten Rätseldesign und guter Charakterentwicklung überzeugt. Jedoch wurde die klassische Formel ein bisschen abgeändert, so das es auch für moderne Spieler ansprechend ist. Zusätzlich dazu gibt es noch eine sehr aktive Mod-Community wo auch schon verschiedene genre Klassiker in Legend of Grimrock zu neuen leben erwacht sind.

Das volle Review gibt’s auf Youtube:
Vidéo YouTube™: Meine Indie Überraschung - Legend of Grimrock - INDIE FEEDBACK #016 
Vues : 12
Legend of Grimrock ist ein klassischer Dungeoncrawler der mit sehr guten Rätseldesign und guter Charakterentwicklung überzeugt.

Recommandé
33.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2014
Finally a dungeon crawler for modern age!
This is a lovely homage to the old school grid based dungeon crawler genre, easy enough to learn so the younger generation of gamers can enjoy it, but truly challenging enough what older gamers would expect.
Well balanced, fun, proper achievements and hours of gameplay with an affordable price tag.
Highly recommended for anyone who love single player adventure and rpg-games in fantasy style.

Be aware though that if you never had played any grid based dungeon crawler games before, the controls will probably feel a little awkward for the first minutes, but just learn how to move properly and soon you will be dancing around the enemies :)

(Sorry for any grammar errors, English is not my native language)

Recommandé
22.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2016
The good

Old school feel - like an updated Stonekeep or Lands of Lore, two old games I liked
Crisp, clean visuals and effects
Compelling game, makes you want to move forward
Make your own levels - what's not to like?
Combat can be challenging, but see the bad
Some of the puzzles are real headscratchers

The bad

Those godawful timed puzzles
No real role-playing to be had - your characters are mere portraits, no story, no character, nada
Combat, while challenging if you actually confront it, can be put into easy mode by simply square-dancing around mobs, or avoiding them altogether
At times, the game expects you to have kept hold of stuff you'd ordinarily have thrown away
High frustration levels at times

Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2019
This is hands down one of the best grid-based dungeon crawler games, great dungeon design, extremely difficult puzzles that require players to actually spend time to find the clues and solve it. Lots of secrets and hidden tunnels inside the dungeon, Legend of Grimrock gives you the feeling of loneliness, the fear of unknown or being trapped, and the atmosphere of claustrophobia. 9/10 (the ending is meh)

Semplice, immediato, ben fatto, ♥♥♥ un grado di sfida stimolante. Lo consigli a tutti gli amanti del genere.

장점
1. 언어장벽이 낮다
2. 적절한 난이도.
3. 깔끔한 인터페이스
4. 턴제가 아닌 실시간 전투로 긴장감 상승

단점
1. 퍼즐 비중이 큼. 케릭터 성장의 재미는 별로.
2. 일일이 벽보고 스위치 찾아야 해서 짜증유발
3. 아쉬운 볼륨. 인디게임이니 그러려니.

username_1975
101 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
54.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2016
Une bonne surprise que ce "Dungeon Crawler". La description me faisait penser à "Eye of The Beholder" et bien.. c'est exactement la même ambiance et le même bon vieux GampePlay.

Je l'ai fait en mode Hard et OldSchool, j'ai donc pris une feuille à petit carreaux et un crayon gris et là... que de souvenirs (je me fais vieux je sais...). Après 20 heures d'aventure j'ai pu arriver à la fin du dongeon avec beaucoup de plaisir.

En réalité j'ai passé environ 50 heures avec les rechargements, la cartographie et la chasse aux trésors/succès. Par contre une fois les niveaux connus dans tous les recoins, je n'ai pas envie de recommencer avec une nouvelle équipe.

Même si les combats sont un peu répétitifs, la gestion de la faim, du poids, de la lumière (aaah les torches), des XP, la recherche des passages, la résolution des enigmes et les différents monstres donnent un beau jeu en soi.

Ne cherchez pas une aventure avec des interactions avec des PNJs... il n'y en a pas ou... très très peu. C'est du pur porte/monstre/trésor avec un déplacement case par case, mais quel pied de résoudre un puzzle ou de trouver un passage secret!

Les graphismes et les bruitages sont tout à fait dans le ton et contribuent à l'ambiance, les décors ne sont certes pas variés sur les 13 niveaux mais finallement celà ne m'a pas trop gêné.

A recommender absolument pour ceux qui ont aimé EoB, Ishar, Lands of Lore, Might&Magic (pas le Heroes)... pour les autres joueurs c'est une belle entrée en matière.

PS : En scrutant bien tous les endroits et en explorant partout, il est possible d'obtenir tous les succès, un bouton n'est jamais là au hasard... Bon, j'ai quand même du me retapper tous les niveaux plusieurs fois pour ne rien laisser de côté.
 
mac.hogan
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2014
What shall i say? It feels (and plays) like the "good old times"-dungeon crawlers, yet looks modern with more than decent graphics and models. It even looks pretty great with 3D Glasses (Helix).

Do i recommend it? YES! But only if you liked them old crawler or these things sound interesting to you if you don't know them at all:

- building a party you'll never really see except their portraits (get the fat pack from nexusmods!)
- wander around a dungeon room by room and not step by step (no free movement)
- fighting monsters with a simple click or casting spells by recalling the patterns (from easy to less easy)
- rest to heal/refresh mana
- use the mouse to find possible switches or something on wall/grounds (point-and-click-adventure-like)
- solving minor puzzles of switches/traps/whatnot
- die and reload :-)

I really liked it (so much that i just bought it on steam just to support the developers. Hence my few playtime). And I'm no hardcore old-schooler, i also love Skyrim :-)
 
Kodijack!
2,439 produits enregistrés

20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2021
TL;DR: Loved the first four hours. Great art-style, intuitive UI and fine old-school gameplay... ruined be tedious searching and counter-intuitive puzzles.

This has a fantastic old-school feel which I really like. It has a great art-style, an extremely intuitive UI (except the spell casting bit) and great gameplay... for the first 3 or 4 hours or so. I also like the atmosphere and combat. Unfortunately, (and it's a BIG "unfortunately" cos I really enjoyed most of my 4.8 hours of play) there is just a bit too much awkward searching involved that impedes enjoyment - including for cracks in the wall and for small keys.

I was stumped at one point cos I had to bypass a teleport square. The solution? Do a 180 degree turn to face the wall behind you, click the crack in the brickwork to make said portal disappear and then quickly step two squares backwards before the portal blocks you again. The problem is, as the portal is just past a right-turn corner you would never know the crack is there because it's on your left as you do the turn. (Yeh, I had to YouTube that one.)

The last straw was when I couldn't find a key to progress giving me two burdensome choices: (1) Go back to YouTube to watch the entire walkthrough of the Old Tunnels area again or (2) Search the whole area myself - again - to find the offending item. Choices that I couldn't be doing with.
 
frankieparsons
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
24.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2023
Awesome dungeon crawler. My first foray into the genre. Right at the start, the menu music is fire.

Then you get into the game. And wow! One thing this game excels at above all others is atmosphere and ambience. Besides the main menu music, there really isn't any music in the actual game. Just the ambient sounds of a decrepit dungeon. In fact, it can be downright eerie. I got jumpscared a few times after running into a monster I could barely make out in part of the dungeon.


One thing to note is that this game is like 60% puzzles, 20% secret-finding and 20% actual combat. Thankfully, for the most part, unlike other games I've tried since in the genre, you should be able to figure out most, if not all, the puzzles on your own ingame. No looking up 40 year old forum posts!

I highly recommend playing on easy difficulty for the first time and the default party works well.

Great game. Keep an eye out for buttons in the walls and pits on the ground! Oh. and ♥♥♥♥ spiders.
 
Gay Lord
3,422 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2014
Old school RPG ala Dungeon Masters and eyes of beholders. Wow, didn't expect to see a game like this in 2013. Hardcore like the old days. Younger players might be disappointed in the gameplay mechanics so know what you are buying. Great game, great puzzles, and great nostalgia.

*Update* completed the game. Seriously hardcore stuff and very unforgiving. Due to a lack of time and sometimes general frustration with certain puzzles, I supplemented with a walk through. Without the walkthrough, this game would had taken me months like I did with dungeon master or quit entirely.

Overall, very enjoyable. Well done.
 
Noob

Recommandé
52.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2012
Grimrock keeps you up. It's tough as nails, but it scratches that dungeon crawler itch... That "Eye of the Beholder/Dungeon Master/So many late 80's early 90's games it's hard to count" dungeon crawler itch. And unlike its roguelike cousins, grimrock is a meticulously plotted and paced experience.

I'll admit I probably spent more time playing this than was strictly necessary, but I combed every wall for hidden switches, I slashed every tapestry to see if a cubby of treasure hid beneath, in short, Grimrock hid dozens upon dozens of little wonders and I couldn't help but go seek.

My only criticism is, I think a new game + would have been amazing. Being able to play through the game again at a harder difficulty with your entire party and all its equipment would've rocked. But other than that... I loved it. If you like your games difficult and intelligent, your monsters menacing and your character progression rewarding, buy this game.

Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2017
이제 시작한 수준이지만 추억에 잠겨 평가를 작성한다.
오래전에 아이 오브 더 비홀더 (Eye of the Beholder)라는 게임이
한국에 '주시자의 눈' 인가하는 제목으로 있었던 기억이 난다.
정말 오래전 이야기 이다.

그 게임을 머라이어케리 노래 들으며 밤새도록 했었는데..
당시 추억을 소환하는 게임인것 같다.
정말로 재미있게 끝까지 클리어한 몇 되지 않는 게임으로 기억한다.

자... 추억에 빠져 볼까?

즐거운 노래를 들은 이유는 무서웠던 것 같다.


어라.. 근데 이거 쉽지 않은데??

Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2017
Now THIS is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game. No hand holding, no hints, no extra lives.
Dungeon Crawling at it's finest.
Intense moments of combat as you're swarmed on all sides, and boxed in.
Awesome puzzles making for many "Ahah!" moments.
Great soundtrack and sound effects.
This game comes together well on so many levels I'm ashamed that I passed by this title so many times.
Pro tip, to make the game an actual challenege, I highly recommend NOT using the save feature, and only relying on Quick Saves at Crystal check points.
This is a must buy for RPG fans.
 
Kip
549 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2015
Vidéo YouTube™:  
Vues : 0


Legend of Grimrock: a classic dungeon crawling role-playing game. Legend of Grimrock gets it right by keeping the premise simple and making the game easy and interactive while making sure to put the challenge in the combat and the puzzle solving.

You were four prisoners who were shoved into the depths of Mount Grimrock to atone for your crimes, you are free the moment you fall, however you have to escape Grimrock if you want to enjoy your freedom, and that’s the story. There are tidbits of lore and story in scroll, text on walls and various objects you find throughout Grimrock, its simple and that’s honestly for the best.

The game plays up the survival part well with needing to keep your guys fed or risk of getting hungry, health and energy regenerate although slowly, you can rest but risk getting attacked while resting.

Graphics weren’t top notch for the time it came out, but they don’t feel dated or old, they’re more than adequate and the style of the dungeon and its inhabitants is very realistic in tone. There is no music throughout most of the game; instead you get this creepy ambiance similar to Amnesia or Penumbra games. It isn’t meant to scare as much as it is to create a tone of dread from hearing ‘things’ in the distance, again the game feels like it’s going more for a realistic immersion.

Combat is much more interesting and tactical, your team is in a 2x2 formation, two in front and back, the two in front are taking the brunt of the damage while the two in back are support, you can switch these positions easily and you often will in order to save companions from death or to rotate dealing damage, spells are cast by selecting the correct rune sequence, you can do this as long as your skill level lets you and you know the combination, you can find scrolls that tell you correct rune combinations, but these aren’t required, you can find them through experimentation, or if you don’t care about finding it out, the internet.

You can also craft in this game various potions from the reagents you find in Grimrock, potions can be simple healing or energizing potions to better damage or even invisibility, again you can find the correct combination through experimentation or scroll and recipes.

Finally the puzzles in the game are much more challenging, there are a few simple and easy ones to begin with, but, even in the first room you start in there are various secret switch to hidden treasures, and as you progress the game starts putting more challenging riddles up for you to solve, some necessary to progress others to great treasures to help you survive. Overall, I felt the puzzle solving in this game was a good balance between challenging while also not needing to be overly difficult.

Legend of Grimrock is a great throwback to dungeon crawling RPGs, it shows that this type of game can easily be done and be fun if done well, it’s simple and easy to get into and actually gave me quite a challenge and I was really impressed once I finished the game, it took me about 20 hours to beat the game, and for $14.99 USD that is not bad at all. I highly recommend this game if you’re looking for good ole fashioned role-playing games, or just something different from the standard fair now-a-days, if you need that more action oriented role-playing game, Grimrock may not be for you, although I still feel it’s just as fun, if not more.

TL/DL; Legend of Grimrock is a classic dungeon crawling RPG with up to 20 hours of gameplay at only $14.99 USD, it’s a steal and well worth the price, its challenging, creepy, and interesting, it’s simple in its gameplay and story making it easy to jump in, it’s worth checking it out of you enjoy RPGs in general, if you need more action oriented RPGs, it may not be for you, but, I encourage you to check it out, you won’t regret it.

-Double Thumbs Up from Royial

Video Reviews: https://www.youtube.com/RoyialNetwork
 
Royial

Recommandé
29.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2018
When I was a kid, reading Lord of the Rings, the most fascinating part of the first book was the journey through the halls of Moria. A twisting labyrinth of narrow corridors, tombs, chambers and stairs winding through the rock of the Misty Mountains. How long had they been there? Who first carved them from the rock eons ago? What secrets lay within?

Later, one of the first PC games I ever played was a first-person grid-based dungeon-crawler CRPG. There is something about the first-person perspective that captures the personal wonder and excitement of exploring dungeons like no other experience. Perhaps looking out of the protagonist's eyes instead of directing them from above is more immersive.

If you want this experience, play Legends of Grimrock. It is a fantastic evocation of that feeling, in a game that is visually beautiful, and features amazing design. Take it slow, soak in the feeling of being there, and explore. If you are undecided, give it a try, and you might be suprised.
 
planet_killah

整體而言 Legend of Grimrock是款不管新舊玩家都能體驗地城冒險的好遊戲

Non recommandé
21.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2017
Well,
I like this game and I don't. It invokes a weird mix of nostalgia and frustration spiced with a bit of 'is this it?'

Let me explain: I'm an older player so I grew up with games like wizardry, Eye of the Beholder etc. That's the nostalgia part summed up. I've done it before and liked it.

Now for frustration: unless you have the reflexes of a teenager, you are going to reload and reload until, by fluke, you pass the generously sprinkled reflex. I hate this stuff even more than jump puzzles in other games.

And now for the spice: here and there you can find a new weapon, armor or spell. But they are few and far between and offer next to nothing but a bit more damage etc. Same goes for spells: there are 20 or so spells in the game and half of those nearly useless. So you spam the same spell to oblivion over and over again.

Conclusion: pretty boring and frustrating.
 
Troicinet

Muy recomendado.

9.5/10

Ein spannendes und selbst auf niedrigeren Schwierigkeitsstufen, ziemlich forderndes Spiel!
Jedes Level besteht aus unmengen Rätseln und versteckten Kammern, sowie immer stärker werdender Gegner.
Um das Spiel auf ,,Hard" zu schaffen, muss man echt schon Zeit und Skill mitbringen!
An sich aber ein lohnendes und fesselndes Spielerlebnis.
Zwar ist die Story nicht gerade der Wahnsinn, aber alleine das Knobeln und Kämpfen mit dem genialen Kampfsystem macht diesen kleinen Makel um Längen wieder wett!
Echt zu empfehlen!

Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2017
Rating Legend of Grimrock is difficult. Personally, I feel as if this is one of the best titles I've played in a long time, despite some of its gratuitous flaws. Movies are sometimes judged on their ability to make people forget their problems for a couple of hours - the immersion. LoG definitely has that going for it, and even when stumped and dying repeatedly, I couldn't pull myself away. This is a sleeper hit that everyone should at least try.

Recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2012
Criado pela Almost Human, uma desenvolvedora finlandesa, você controla um grupo de aventureiros que procuram fugir da prisão que fica no topo da montanha homônima e para isso é necessário descer cada vez mais. Se você for fã de clássicos como Eye of the Beholder e Dungeon Master ou um entusiasta neófito do gênero dungeoncrawler então este jogo vale o seu tempo e dinheiro.

A jogabilidade é em tempo real, a movimentação é por grade, mas os desafios e quebra-cabeças são de dificuldade "old school" e isso pode frustrar alguns. Por falar nisso, existe um modo no jogo chamado old school em que você não tem acesso ao mapa, o recomendado é pegar um bloco de papel milimetrado (ou imprimir o PDF que está na pasta do jogo) e desenhar você mesmo o seu progresso. É possível notar as melhorias que o jogo recebeu em relação a seus antecessores, mas ainda são mecânicas datadas que nem todo jogador vai saber apreciar.

E você pode tirar mais proveito ainda da rejogabilidade visitando outras masmorras criadas pelos usuários (através do editor interno) e que ficam disponíveis na Oficina Steam. Se depois disso tudo você ainda quiser mais lembre-se que depois do sucesso deste título, Legend of Grimrock 2 está disponível no Steam também!

Vidéo YouTube™: Saiu e Você Não Viu? - | Legend of GrimSalsa - Legend of Grimrock

3,133 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
11.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2015
Reseña en Ociotakus: http://www.ociotakus.com/legend-of-grimrock-resena/
Reseña en mi blawgh: http://www.agustinfest.com/2015/12/resena-legend-of-grimrock/

Legend of Grimrock revivió un género de videojuegos que parecía extinto: Dungeon Crawler FPS (en español: explorador de calabozos en primera persona, quíhubo). En este juego, tú tomas el rol de cuatro prisioneros que son arrojados a las mazmorras de Grimrock y durante 13 pisos, tienes que matar monstruos y criaturas, resolver acertijos y encontrar tesoros. Mientras haces todo ello, si eres un viejo gamer como yo, puedes morir un poco de nostalgia por aquellos terrores de antaño cuando explorabas en 8 bits/16 bits y no sabías si a la vuelta te encontrarías ♥♥♥ una araña gigante.

La ambientación del juego es excelsa. Las texturas, la iluminación y los modelos de las criaturas te involucran y te sumergen inmediatamente adentro del juego. No tiene mucha música pero eso no importa cuando escuchas los sonidos de fondo. Pronto aprenderás que es mejor agudizar el oído porque en cuánto una criatura entra en acción, caminará en la oscuridad de todo el calabozo para perseguirte. No olvides llevar suficientes antorchas.

Acerca de la historia, todavía no llevo mucho pero los misterios picaron mi interés. Al parecer, cuando duermes, una entidad mágica y misteriosa entra a tus sueños para pedirte ayuda y que la rescates. Por otra parte, un aventurero desafortunado ha dejado notas por todo el calabozo que te dicen dónde ha dejado sus armas, su comida y otros objetos que ya no pudo cargar consigo. Las runas, los acertijos y las estatuas crean un escenario interesante y, aunque incompleto, tentador para que el jugador llene los espacios en blanco.

Aunque estoy jugando en dificultad normal, el juego no me ha perdonado fácilmente. Quizá sería interesante jugarlo en difícil y sin mapa automático (como se hacía antes (insertar sonido de viejito chocho). Creo que todavía tengo cuadernos ♥♥♥ mapas de otros juegos. La ambientación de Legend of Grimrock es tan poderosa, que suelo explorar tan sólo la mitad de un calabozo en vez de completarlo porque siento la urgencia de descansar. Rara vez hago eso ♥♥♥ un juego. Y todavía más raro: el cansancio y el regreso son muy satisfactorios. Es como una lectura o un dulce que se disfruta despacio. Un mundo familiar y ajeno a la vez.

Por si fuera poco, hay mucho contenido de la comunidad gamer para extender el juego. Calabozos e historias nuevas construidas por fanáticos, no sólo de Grimrock, pero de Dungeons & Dragons, Zelda y otros mundos fantásticos, están en Steam Works esperando a ser descubiertos. Creo que es obvio; recomiendo Legend of Grimrock: sin dudarlo, pienso que es una obra maestra dentro de su género.
 
arboltsef
3,447 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2019
Welcome to your prison and grave. Welcome to Mount Grimrock.

* Pros
+ Old school tile based dungeon crawling (sadly isn't really seen anymore in gaming)
+ Graphics and lighting are great
+ Insanely complex puzzles that'll want to make you scream. But once you get that "Aha" moment, it's incredibly satisfying.
+ Fun combat and group mechanics where you need to manage your health and hunger (hunger doesn't deplete fast so it is highly manageable)
+ Lots of interesting secrets and floors to explore
+ The story is pretty good, there is also a cool and interesting twist at the end
+ The magic system is neat

* ♥♥♥♥
- I wish it were longer
- The stats and things characters can do is very limited (except magic)
- Small enemy variety
- Some puzzle are almost impossible figure out without help

* Side Notes
Sadly, a lot of these types of games aren't made anymore. LoG leaves wanting so much more but there is a distinct lack of newer games that are made like LoG is.

Overall: 9/10 Amazing

Must Have? | Buy? | Wait for Sale? | Don't Buy This?
[Must Have]
 
D-Rock Gaming

Puzzles, enemigos, variedad de armas ... Legend of Grimrock lo tiene todo para ser un título excelente salvo un buen argumento.

Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2014
Потрясающая игра!!!
Игра хоть и кажется простой судя по управлению и геймплею, но очень интересная и сложная
Отличный саундтрек и атмосфера на высоте!
Единственное к чему можно придраться так это к тому что всю игру вы будете в подземелье, хотя мне это ничуть не мешает.
Если вам интересен жанр Dungeon Crawler на современном движке, то не пожалеете
Удачи :)

Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2014
The Legend of grimrock is a 3-d dungeon crawler which is hard, rage causing, keyboard breaking fun. Yes i said fun, the game is fun, but when its not fun its frustrating. I like the game alot due to the fact that it reminds me of the game King's Quest, in the fact that most of your time is either puzzle solving or combat. Overall i like the game and i would say buy it for the diffulculty, which is also the reason why i think the game didn't sell as much as it should have made, because now and days people expect easy games like Call of Duty or Minecraft. So try the game out if you want,i can say wether or not you'll like it but hey atleast check it out on Twitch or Youtube......

Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2021
Рекомендую всем олдам и любителям игр данного жанра. Единственная проблема игры - загадки. Дело не в их сложности, или количестве. большинство из них вроде бы логичные, хотя иногда и надо посидеть и подумать, НО, некоторые упарываются в непонятную дичь (без шуток, там есть загадки где тебе нужно решить непонятное уравнение, и далеко не каждый сможет самостоятельно это осилить, слава богу в наше время есть интернет),несмотря на то, что это больше "побочные" задания, и можно пройти мимо, на мой взгляд странно делать загадки с "возрастным ограничением". Так же в этом плане игра гораздо менее душная чем вторая часть, но если вы 5Head то рекомендую к прохождению и её

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2013
Невероятно увлекательный dungeon crawler с довольно простенькой механикой. Сначала кажется что шляпа. Но потом оторваться невозможно, несмотря на однообразность и медитативность.

Очень интересна подача сюжета: записки, надписи на стенах, видения во сне. Несмотря на это игра не грузит горами текста, диалогами, роликами... да и сюжетом вообще.
Зато имеется давящая атмосфера мрачного фэнтези (мрачностью и клаустрофобией игра напоминает Arx Fatalis) и бесконечные лабиринты и головоломки. Графика, кстати, хоть и простенькая, но на уровне, - текстурки резкие, подземелья мрачные, монстры симпатичные.

Это геймплей в чистом виде. Включаю, когда хочу отдохнуть часик другой от суеты мира. С нетерпением жду вторую часть и Might&Magic X.

PS Отсутствия русского языка можете не пугаться. Текста в игре крайне мало. А если не разберётесь, можете нагуглить русификатор от ZoG.
 
Asti the cat
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2014
Excellent dungeon crawler, it brings together nice visuals with classic gameplay. Reminded me of Portal but with a D&D twist.

+Graphics, dungeons, and monsters all look great.
+3 classes to choose from (Fighter/Mage/Rogue), each with different skills
+Create your own party of 4 characters, even import portraits if you like (takes a little know-how)
+A decent variety of skill choices and couple weapon choices per class, with adaptability through leveling
+Story and puzzle elements blend together well, some challenging puzzles
+Unique spellcasting system using runes like a combination lock
+Lots of secrets to uncover and feel rewarded with both equipment and achievements
+Probably the most impressive part is that it comes with a dungeon editor - play others' or make your own!

-Few default portrait choices for characters
-No animations or models for your characters themselves, no voiced dialogue
-No cross-classing for any skills/abilities
-No shops or salvage system makes looting feel pointless/lackluster at times
-Availability of some items unnecessarily punishes some skill choices
-Spell system can become more of a chore in combat as the game goes on
 
Darkclaw3050
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
26.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 septembre 2014
Legends of Grimrock
Antes que nada Legends of Grimrock es un dungeon Crawlers, genero en el cual un grupo se interna en una estructura (castillo, mazmorra, etc) laberintica y separada por niveles motivando su exploracion por un argumento laxo.
No es un genero que tenga muy curtido y el ultimo que toque fue el Etrian Oddysey. Pero en fin, el juego me ha gustado y aqui os dejo mi recomendacion.

Historia:
La historia parte de como un grupo de traidores son llevados a la cima del monte Grimrok para ser absueltos de sus crimenes siendo arrojados a la fosa de la cima, el mensaje es claro, la libertad sera tuya si eres capaz de llegar a la falda de la montaña. Todo esto mostrado en la cinematica de inicio de partida.
No tendras mas contacto ♥♥♥ el desarrollo de la historia del juego salvo las notas de Toorum (un prisionero que sufrio la misma suerte) y unos extraños sueños. No hay carga narrativa ni una trama especialmente complicada. Imagino que lo tipico de los dungeon crawlers por lo poco que tengo visto.

A mi personalmente me a molestado la falta total de dialogos del grupo o que nunca interactues que ningun otro personaje de forma directa. Al final persiste un sentimiento de soledad

Grupo y combate:
Puedes iniciar el juego ♥♥♥ el grupo recomendado o crear uno propio, la formacion se divide en 2 delante y 2 detras en formacion cuadrada. El daño recibido se limita a la formacion salvo en el caso de los ataques magicos (si te golpean por delante los 2 de enfrente asumiran el daño mientras los 2 de detras estaran a salvo). Los combates son en tiempo real ♥♥♥ cooldown de habilidades y ataques.

En este apartado es donde se encuentra la mayor pega del titulo.

Los combates en Legends of Grimrock se basan en atacar a los enemigos mientras te mueves por el escenario lo que acaba derivando en "bailes", en el modo normal del juego no tuve problemas para esquivar/evadir la mayoria de ataques. Todo consiste en aprender a moverse ♥♥♥ agilidad.
El problema es que esto acaba afectando al uso del grupo que ya de por si arrastra varias faltas leves entre las que destacaria: poca cantidad de clases (3), falta de definicion de las clases (los guerreros como tanques no tienen utilidad debido a los bailes, la clase apoyo/curacion no existe, los ladrones son la unica clase ♥♥♥ arboles de ataques a distancia no magicos, etc), las razas estan muy limitadas a roles muy concretos lo que le resta agilidad, pocas opciones a la hora de personalizar, las estadisticas estan descompensadas (salvo volutad para magos, se acaba subiendo la fuerza ♥♥♥ el resto de las classes ya que es la unica estadistica que sube el ataque independientemente del rol), poca diversidad de habilidades y hechizos, .....

Tambien tiene sus aciertos como la barra de comida o el sistema para lanzar hechizos (debido a que los magos son la unidad mas fuerte es logico que se tarde mas en atacar ♥♥♥ ellos y el sistema de runas logra este efecto) aunque ♥♥♥ los ultimos necesitaras encontrar los pergaminos para aprender a lanzar los hechizos o hacer uso de prueba/error.

Los miembros del grupo no tienen ni dialgos ni sonidos, nada que ayude al jugador a distraerse o combatir la monotomia en que puede derivar el moverse por los diversos niveles.

Graficos:
El apartado visual es bastante bueno. El juego se desarrolla en primera persona y los detalles estan cuidados, desde el juego de sombras y luces hasta las animaciones de los enemigos.
No he tenido ningun problema ni error grafico, el juego era estable y fluido lo que es de gran ayuda en los combates.

La unica pega es la falta de diversidad de escenarios ya que practicamente hay 2 tipos de escenarios, el primero durante los primeros 11 niveles ♥♥♥ cambios leves en la decoracion y luego el set de la prision que dejara a mas de uno impresionado despues de la monotomia que suponen los primeros.

Puzzles y secretos:
He aqui el alma del juego, los puzzles. El principal motivo de esta recomendacion es el diseño de niveles y los puzzles que contienen.

Y es que empezaras el juego ♥♥♥ unos cuantos puzzles clasicos de tirar palancas o pisar losas pero pronto te encontraras rebuscando el escenario para encontrar pistas. Cosas tan cripticas como los mismos nombres de las salas (Sala cuadriculada) pueden ser pistas vitales, mas de una vez desearas encontrar algun pergamino de Toorum ♥♥♥ alguna indicacion o pista para poder pasar a la siguiente zona. Algunos alcanzan dificultades surrealistas y te desesperaras por encontrarles algun sentido, otros simplemente te dejaran confundido y perdido.
♥♥♥ cada nivel te soprenderas por la variedad y complejidad de algunos. El diseño de niveles esta pensado a la perfeccion para que notes una progresion real entre las diferentes salas y pasadizos de los niveles. Sumale en muchos casos los cambios bruscos de niveles que desorientan (caidas en pozos), ataques sorpresa por la espalda al completar algun puzzle que libere una horda de monstruos y que te obligara a una rapida retirada o trampas venenosas o mortales.

Y la cosa se pone mejor cuando a este coctel le añades una cantidad bastante grande de secretos de todo tipo: premios secretos por resolver los puzzles de varias formas, pasadizos secretos, puertas de hierro que esconden tesoros, desafios de combate y mini-mazmorras, etc. Es increible la cantidad de secretos que encontraras.

Lo logico es pensar que una vez aprendido la localizacion de los botones secretos (debido a que la decoracion de los escenarios apenas varia rapidamente se entiende que los botones suelen estar a la misma altura y posicion) la tarea de revelar las mejores armas y armaduras seria facil, no? Nada mas lejos de la verdad. La variedad de secretos no es comparable a la de los puzzles pero sudaras la gota gorda para encontrar-los y superarlos (porque no todo sera fijarte en las paredes, tambien habra que realizar rapidos movimientos para esquivar las trampas o pulsar rapidamente una serie de botones en el orden correcto)

Todo lo bueno:
- Buena duracion (25 horas)
- Los mejores puzzles que he visto en mucho tiempo (y no se repiten)
- Cantidad de secretos
- Tiene Workshop por lo que hay variedad de aventuras y configuraciones
- Buen diseño grafico
- Ningun bug
- No hay muchos juegos de este genero y lo convierte en un juego de compra obligada
- Variedad de enemigos

Todo lo malo:
- Nada que resaltar de la BSO
- El juego no esta en castellano (existe una traduccion realizada por guiaspat: http://guiaspat.com/foro/index.php?topic=1613.0)
- En los combates y en el grupo es donde mas flojea
- La ambientacion de los escenarios es muy limitada
- Para algunas personas puede resultar tedioso la tarea de rebuscar en cada piso



En resumen un juego imprecindible si te gusta el genero o la exploracion y los puzzles. La relacion precio (10.99€) / calidad lo convierte en una excelente compra. Ademas el workshop alarga la vida del titulo. 8,5/10
 
Triple R
1,334 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
19.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2021
TL;DR A great game with fantastic atmosphere

Pros:

- Atmosphere: I cannot reiterate how much fun I had with this games atmosphere. It's atmosphere oozes pulpy fantasy and everything from the ambient sounds to creature design adds to the games sword and board feel.
- Music: The music in this game is fantastic and really captures the pulp fantasy feel the game is going for.
-Combat: Combat is perhaps a tad bit too slow for my liking but still very fun and the class system also feels very intuitive.

Neutral:

- Length: I personally felt the game was of a decent length. It took me around 10 hours to complete a play through which I personally find fine but your mileage may vary. There is a decent amount of replayability (especially with the games class system) and the game comes with a level editor which from what I've seen has led to some very well put together levels being available on the workshop.
- Puzzling: If you do not like puzzles you will not enjoy this game. Some of these puzzles also involve backtracking. I enjoyed them but can see how others might find them frustrating
- Story: A very minor flaw made up for by the excellent atmosphere of the game but still one worth noting is that the story for this game is far from great. By the end of my first playthrough I had a fairly decent idea of what was going on but the story overall is very bland. Your mileage may vary.

Conclusion:

An excellent dungeon crawler. Fun atmosphere and engaging combat. Worth playing and a decent place to start for those new to the genre.
 
George Lucas

상당히 어려운 게임
퍼즐이나 비밀 통로들이 많아서 처음할때는 고생이 이만저만이 아니다
특히 몇몇 보물이나 비밀 통로는 공략이 없이는 찾기가 거의 불가능하기 때문에
공략은 거의 필수!
하지만 게임에 익숙해지고 맨손격투와 몇몇 스킬의 위력을 알게되면
게임이 훨씬 쉬워진다.
정말 재미있게 즐긴 게임이고 취향에 따라 호불호가 갈릴 수 있지만 누구에게나 추천하고싶은 게임이다.
추천!!!

Non recommandé
69.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2020
"The game brings back the oldschool challenge with highly tactical real-time combat and grid-based movement..."

Tactical... Yeah, right.
This is a dungeon crawler alright, but the game is a failure as an RPG.
EVEN if you'd switch to an easier difficulty it's impossible to build a party that could stand its ground against late game enemies.
Note the phrasing though. It's not that you can't defeat them, no, you just can't do it standing in place.
Solution – move your ass before it gets hit.
Result of that solution – your combat stats don't actually matter.
This is a game won by you dancing in circles... eh... scratch that, won by you dancing in squares with your enemies. Stand in a diagonally adjacent square, wait for the dumbass to move to an adjacent square, hit him fast with whatever and then move away again before his “turn” cd runs out. Repeat until you either clear the stupid game or get bored to death. Yeah it's that kind of “real” time btw – with everything happening once in a while. The only practical difference from turn based is that the game doesn't wait for you when ending turns.

If you do it on easy, then for about half the game you can actually fight real RPG battles.
On normal you can keep it fun for waaay less than that.

What appalls me me the most is that combat was clearly intended to be this dumb square dance.
If the mob difficulty doesn't make it apparent then certain late game enemies will.
And if they don't well...

It's kinda spoiling, but I think this SHOULD be spoiled.
Last boss is a freaking cube. All it ever does is move (there are other mobs on that level though that do fight you normally) and it kills you by “rolling” onto your square squashing you like a quartet of bugs.

And they said ME3's ending was a letdown...
Even if this boss wasn't a letdown mechanically it'd still be a story bummer.
It was supposed be a dungeon build to contain ultimate evil. And ultimate evil is... a cube.

FFS it's a cube, all it can do is “roll”. Dig a square shaped hole in the ground, reinforce the borders, put it in and you're done. It'll never roll out of there. No need to build any dungeons or buildup any adventurer's hopes.

I've played this around 8 yeas ago, and I still can't get over how ridiculous that ending was when I get reminded of it.

One other thing this game doesn't mention is that it will try to scare you. Not an easy thing to accomplish for a game when the worst it could do to you is make you reload, but it manages.
After you delve a few levels down you'll meet the spiders (arachnophobia alert btw, you definitely wanna stay away if you've got it) tough little buggers, and kinda fugly. Thing is, they pose real danger in the game and you'll want to stay on alert for them. Then a bit further down you'll have to deal with a whole level of them which is where it gets jumpy. See, it's a level with opening “secret passages”. Basically, it opens numerous hidden doors to rooms with nothing but spiders in them, and does so some time after you pass those doors (in a pre-determined trigger locations respectable distance away from the doors).
So yeah a whole level of a mob that easily kills your party, looks freaky, makes sounds from behind walls and is released behind you in the areas you thought you cleared.

Nice effort on the developer's part I guess, and successful one at that, if only the task was worthy...
For comparison - AVP never managed to scare me. Threat of backstabbing spiders DID. Except I don't remember signing up for anything like that. I'm not into being startled. YMMV I guess?

The dungeon delving part is pretty well done. Traps, switches, puzzles secret rooms, you name it they did it, and they did it well. If that kind of (IMHO) childish fun is what you're looking for you will not be disappointed either.

I was. I was looking for a dungeon crawling RPG. Something like one dungeon version of Wizardry 8 or Might and Magic 8. And I've got everything BUT what I've been looking for in a game.

If you're looking for a dungeon crawler and aren't against the idea of being startled by spiders then this is one of the most well crafted games you could find, except maybe the part about last boss being so anti-climactic.

But if you're looking for an RPG, you know, the kind of game where you build up your character(s) and win or lose based on that buildup instead of you ability to press buttons every few seconds, then you'll not find a more overrated pile of garbage than this game.
 
Reianor

Dieses Spiel ist der Hammer. Wer damals schon Dungoncrawler gespielt hat kommt an diesem Spiel nicht vorbei. Und wer zum ersten mal so ein Spiel zu sehen bekommt, anspielen lohnt sich. Die Stimmung ist gut getroffen, und man kann sich schnell verlaufen :). Die kämpfe sind alle gut zu schaffen, mal mit roher gewalt und mal mit einer guten Taktik. Die Rätsel sind manchmal recht harte nüsse, aber mit Geduld, Hirnschmalz und Spucke kann man es schaffen.

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2019
Very interesting approach to puzzle gaming. First person strategic isometric type gameplay where attentive detail could give you a bunch of extra items, food, weapons or armour to tackle stronger enemies. Very interesting story and pretty decent graphix for it's time.

I'd definitely recommend this for anyone wanting to tackle a nice puzzle game where planning is key in combat and having a keen eye for detail as well as figuring out how to escape a dungeon. Cool concept and nice design of the levels, I thoroughly enjoyed the game.

Graphix: 8/10
Story: 8/10
Gameplay: 8/10

Non recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2016
I know many people loved it, but this is not my kind of game.

I expected the combat to be a bit more tactical, but because its active it seems to mostly involve turn-and-circle strafing most enemies and DPSing them down while avoiding being hit. This isn't what I expected from an RPG, even an active one. Theres not much back-and-forth, HP is there to make up for the mistakes you make or if you encounter too many enemies to easily achieve hit and run tactics. Or for if you fall afoul of a trap. Theres not much in the way of resource management, and the best solution is to backtrack to full-heal savepoint crystals for even minor wounds because the only reason to expend consumable resources is in dire emergencies and never to cover normal mistakes. Character progression (from what I remember researching) seemed prone to the trap of making a useless build. Its been awhile, so I could be wrong here and dismiss this if I am.

Speaking of traps, I really dont like the puzzle and trap mechanics in this game. Some of the puzzles are fairly obtuse, which could be okay except that you can end up just wandering forever not seeing a switch on a wall or the like if you dont look up a guide. This is just true of some genres, even ones I love like point and click adventures, but the solution basically spoils part of the game. In P&C games the puzzles are tied to a story. A lot of traps aren't great because they're kind of like being exposed to a jumpscare. 'Haha, got you!' Sometimes you die, sometimes you backtrack to a save crystal because you took somewhere between 1 to 99% damage, sometimes you backtrack because the trap diverted you, etc. A lot of it is just trial and error, some of it is gotchas, but it never really felt clever or fun to me.

Story is also lacking from what I saw. Your characters have no backstory and you occasionally receive cryptic telepathic messages about a mysterious person who knows the mysterious truth behing the mysterious dungeon you are trapped in. I didnt get far enough to figure it out, but I assume its just a premise to tie the gameplay together. That can be okay, but I just didnt personally enjoy the story.

A lot of people liked the game, but do your research first. I like RPGs and have played them all my life, but this one wasn't for me.
 
I'm Not Sue
822 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
68.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2016
This is a great modern game that succeeds in giving players a old school dungeon crawler feel while still manages to be creative.

The Good:
1) "With a 95% positive rating, its likely you will enjoy this game." - Captain Obvious.
2) Good Graphcis
3) Good Music
4) Good RPG experience
5) Creative and smart puzzles/riddles. What's a good dungeon crawler game if it didn't have good dungeon designs?
6) Old school mode. I never had a chance to unds how playing a game while having to draw my own map was like. No longer the case with this game.
7) Extras. Above sound track and concept art, there's actually reading material and quite abit of lore builing. Love the world map and descriptions of each races etc.
8) Good combat, a true test of gaming dexterity and skill.
8a) You will soon realise timing is crucial. If you timed your attacks well enough you can put enemies in a partial stun-lock. consider enemy recovery time and your characters' cooldown etc. Very fun to learn how to exploit this.
8b) I'll say that the combat is clumsy in a good way. You have to draw complicated runes to cast powerful spells. Potions can only be used from inventory. Weapons must be changed in inventory and dragging the icon. Attacks will only be made by right clicking on the correct location where the images of your weapons are. Your archer will have to swap between crossbow+quarrel and bow+arrow (thats 2 item swaps which takes alot of time). You have to pay attention to enemies' attacks and movement and then move your party accordinly to dodge attacks. All of that and much more are all in real time. No pause of combat. Opening maps and inventory only makes you open to enemy attacks instead of pausing the whole game or combat. All these makes this game awesome.

The Bad:
1) Story suck.. I don't actually mind since good story are usually more of a bonus. But the most rememebered and talked about games are the ones with great story. So I find this more a pity than anything else.
2) Replay value. Kinda low since any difference in a 2nd try would be too little to justify the trouble to have to do the entire adventure all over again... Toorum mode was interesting though.

All in all, good game sold at a low price. You're totally losing out if you gave this game a miss.
 
Batman
2
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.7 h en tout

J'ai acheté ce jeu sans m'attendre à quelque chose d'excellent, mais n'ai pas pu en décrocher, du début à la fin.

Wonyo
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2015
Getting lost in this huge dungeon is so great. Even in the age of Witcher 3, this game shows that grid-based movement can still be fun. I have a hard time explaining why but here are some possible factors:
- Enemies feel more menacing because you can't circle-strafe them, play with aggro range or exploit pathfinding bugs against them like in most free movement rpgs/fpss. So the dungeon feels more claustrophobic and menacing... I definitely don't feel that in Skyrim dungeons.
- Mapping out the dungeon square by square and paying close attention to your environment for secret buttons and switches feels great, and it's not the typical modern RPG experience. A free movement game can hardly hide a button somewhere on a wall and expect you to find it, here with the constrained views it works.
- The grid system allows for some very smart puzzles, I have to admit I sometimes give up and consult a walkthrough, but I enjoy their presence nonetheless!

And you get to control (read: juggle) 4 characters, so four times the RPG goodness!

All in all, you'll like it if you liked old-school RPGs like Dungeon Master, Eye of the Beholder and Lands of Lore: Throne of Chaos. But if you haven't played those games you should try it anyways! You might very well find that grid-based movement is a bit like pixel art: originally born of technical limitations, it can still bring a unique and interesting twist to a game.

Once you're done with this one check out Grimrock 2! It's bigger, more varied visually and less linear. The modding scene is also flourishing for both games, though I suspect mods for the second game must be better, modders have more material and a more advanced engine to work with.
 
UncleYar
0

EN0Tik
1,273 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
97.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2014
I want to so much compare Grimrock to DOOM and call it the modern day equivalent. From the deathly isolation, almost nonexistent story, emphasis on secrets and (nearly) out of the gate mod support. It's essentially a one man FPS masquerading as a party oriented RPG.

Though I doubt it'll reach the same cultural reverence, which is a shame, as it has the quality and hallmarks to be right up there.

The dungeon design is immaculate. Hand crafted with its monster placement and puzzles that are beyond devilish. There is a lack of randomly generated maps, but Grimrock will make you wonder why you even liked that as a feature, as everything was setup for the best possible experience. The atmosphere of the game cannot be mentioned enough however, as I have never seen an out of nowhere independent developer make something so polished and so good to look at or listen to. The dank and darkness is not something that can be described, but only experienced when your torch has lost its flame and you can hear the slimy pitter patter of god knows what.

Grimrock features the kind of controls to die for. You move and attack in flashes and can be in and out around a monster in seconds. The combat is never a bore, nor is it fought in one place like a lot of the games it takes inspiration from. Item management could not be any easier, either in or outside combat, and it feels like it read my mind many times as I try and ready a bomb while circling a monster. It's been awhile since I've played anything where I could call the controls "smooth as butter" and actually mean it.

The story is limited, which isn't a complaint. It's refreshing to not have to trawl through so much text to get to the good stuff in an RPG. The only problem is that conclusion of the game isn't very satisfactory as a result. Maybe that's the point. I didn't feel like I got enough out of Grimrock, instead, I just wanted more.

Grimrock is not at all like an old school RPG, and that's why I love it. It takes the template and ideas from older titles like Wizardry or Eye of the Beholder and makes it fast, fluid and simple. Unless you're an absolute die hard for the classics, then there's no reason you shouldn't have played this. Top marks.
 
Green Skeleton

Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2023
For me this genre started long time ago with titles like Dungeon master, Eye of the Beholder or Wizardry.

Legend of Grimrock 1 + 2 I had the honor to play indeed transformed this oldschool experience to new modern experience. I have little to say - there are excellent puzzles, combat is encouraging I like the simple yet reasonable character builds that offer nice variety with classes giving only extra skill and not locking into certain builds.

The game is well balanced and difficult with unforgiving traps and enemies I like.

Very classic experience I can only recommend, in particular to people that know this genre from the past and instead reaload old games from Gog looking for experience something new.
 
Včelí medvídek
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2020
Четверо безымянных пленников, осужденных за предательство, получают помилование. Только не все так просто. Закованных между собой цепями, их высаживают на вершину горы Гримрок, с помощью дирижабля, и бросают в яму. Герои оказываются в начале лабиринта, который необходимо пройти для получения полной свободы. Выход находится у подножия горы.

Игру можно было сделать покороче, хуже бы точно не стало. Загадки под конец начинают надоедать и злить. Больше всего бесят загадки на скорость и со странной логикой (догадывайся, как хочешь).

Боевая система, основанная на рандоме – это печально.

Сюжет и весь лор оставляют много вопросов. Если этот Куб так опасен, то почему его не уничтожили или хотя бы детали спрятали подальше? Если же он важен (необходим для некоторой глобальной цели), тогда зачем запускать туда пленников, у которых есть шанс (хоть и мизерный) уничтожить там все? Да и не слишком ли опасны будут пленники, сумевшие выйти оттуда? Если бы я был сценаристом, то я бы отправил туда героев чтобы разобраться, что же там творится в этой горе.

Как живут и чем питаются в этом лабиринте такие огромные существа, как улитки, пауки, огры совершенно непонятно.

Понравился дизайн некоторых подземелий.

Далеко не шедевр, но поиграть можно. Оценка: 3 из 5.
 
Friendly Face

Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2020
Legend of Grimrock was one of my largest disappointments in the revival of dungeon crawler genre. While it has great graphics and animations as well as atmosphere, it falls short on gameplay aspect. The fact that it is turn-based combat system put into real time completely annihilates entertainment in the dungeon crawling gameplay and replaces it with some awkward arcade "hit & dodge". In addition, there aren't really any visible progress, the game is rather repetitive.

I don't recommend it even for those of you who enjoy dungeon crawlers. At best you can try it if you get it free or for very low price, but you probably won't finish it either.

Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2014
Pure dungeon crawling goodness.
This is not dragon age. It is repetitve, a bit on purpose since it's a dungeon crawling game.

You begin your quest half-naked and you try to get out of this maze.
Oh, and your torch burned out. Woops.
It's dark and you hear something coming your way.

So it's hack n slash everything, try to resolve some puzzles.
Loot what you can.
So far I did not see real role playing.

I say if you are into ''classic'' dungeon crawling this is a must-play.

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
32.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2014
This is a great tribute to the first person RPG's of yesteryear, such as Dungeon Master and the Eye of the Beholder series.

Combat is difficult, and requires careful maneuvering as well as the right builds for your characters. Some of the puzzles are fiendishly difficult, but all of them are fair, and I only had to go searching for solutions a couple of times on my first play through.

Graphically, the game does what it sets out to do very well, though the tile sets and enemy types are all limited. Even so, the look of the game, combined with what turns out to be a surprisingly good sound track add to the intense atmosphere of the whole experience.

The whole thing gives off an almost 'survival horror meets fantasy rpg' hybrid, and one that I greatly enjoyed. I recommend it highly.

0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
22.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2020
I'm giving this game a thumbs up because I liked it just enough to finish it... But it was a close call. LoG is really a mixed bag.

Pros:
+ Very atmospheric, probably triggers nostalgia for a lot of people, including me. In my case it brought me back to Eye of the Beholder for GBA.
+ Level design is pretty good. You'll get turned around sometimes, but generally the maps are easy to memorize and there isn't too much backtracking... aside from some instances I'll mention later.
+ If you like puzzles, obviously this game will appeal to you. And the game rewards you in several ways for solving puzzles, which makes you feel proud of the accomplishment.

♥♥♥♥:
- Combat is tedious. Enemies usually have one attack animation and one sound they make which you will get SICK of hearing after the 100th time. Attacking is repetitive and spammy... You win fights by rapidly clicking on your attacks as soon as they cool down. The game heavily rewards cheesy tactics like kiting.
- Some of the puzzles in the game are a lot of fun, but probably the majority of them are frustrating and illogical. There are a few puzzles which require items to complete, but you are never given any hints that an item you find is actually important. If you don't pick up the right things, you can be backtracking several levels searching for a random piece of garbage you discarded. You have a limited amount of inventory space and you can be burdened if you're carrying too much weight, so I didn't know I was supposed to be saving this junk. There are so many junk items in the game that you'll never know which ones are important without looking at a guide, and it really wouldn't be possible to carry all of them.
- Throughout most the game the enemies aren't a serious threat, but rather an annoyance because of how many are all clustered around in the same areas. Mostly they get in your way while you're trying to solve puzzles. There is a massive difficulty spike toward the end of the game that makes it almost impossible to get through. It's really disappointing when you struggle through a game only to reach a point that's so insanely hard that it almost makes you stop caring.

In short, this is a frustrating, sometimes tedious game that rewarded me only just enough to make me want to continue. I'd really only recommend this game to veterans of the puzzle genre.
 
Khajiit

So without any nostalgia altering my perception of this game I can honestly say that this is an awesome game, the character types ,the secrets, the progression , it’s all done really well, and I would recommend this game to everyone out there , especially if they haven’t played a game with this gameplay style.
Really good game, it allows you to import your own pictures for the portraits of the heroes thus making it a more fun experience, In my team I had Dark Blade (YuGiOh), a Tauren (From Warcraft), Dark Alchemist (From Torchlight 2) and a Argonian (From TES obviously) so I had a unique personal experience XD .
Anyways enough talking, buy this game now ! good game , good games must be bought and played !
4/5!

ウィザードリィの様なオールドタイプのダンジョンマスターゲーム。
ストーリーは一応存在するが、そこまで込み入った話ではなく
ダンジョンを攻略し、脱出することが一番の目標である。
ダンジョンには沢山の隠しボタンや謎解きがあり、脱出ゲームなどが好きで
謎を解き道を切り開くことが好きな人はハマること間違いない。

時間泥棒な、かなりお勧めのゲーム。

ゲームにはダンジョン製作モードもあるので、自分でダンジョンを作って
友人などに遊んでもらうこともできます。

Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2018
A really fun party-building dungeon-crawler packed with puzzles, monsters, and mayhem. Thoroughly enjoyed my playthrough. The base game took me about 22 hours to play through, though that is with a lot of backtracking and looking for secrets. There is also an editor you can use to create your own adventures (and a decent-sized workshop of others' creations), which definitely extends the potential life of the game.

I got it on a sale, but I'd say it's definitely worth it full price (still only $15).

Didn't care for it.
The puzzles were not fun, lots of back-tracking to solve.
Combat is wonky, think it would have been better turn based, but you can kind of kite things around and take no damage making it trivial

Limited races and classes (4 each).
Limited areas to put skill points

If you are looking for a game of this type it may be OK if you play with no map and on the highest difficulty without cheesing combat but it was just annoying to me.

Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
ダンジョンマスターに近いらしいけど未プレイなのでそこはわかりません。
知ってる範囲でいうとWizardry系のDRPGを基調に、
キングスフィールドのようなアクション要素やパズル要素が加わった感じです
といってもアクションやパズルが相当骨太なのでむしろそっちがメインなのかも。

RPG部分は王道で、過不足なく揃ってます。
パズルはDRPGにありがちな暗号文書を読んで回答を出させるタイプというよりは
ポータル的なアクションパズルが多め
戦闘アクションは棒立ちではきつく、中盤以降はヒットアンドアウェイが基本になってくる。
落とし穴や行き止まりや敵の挟み撃ちを回避しつついかに上手く立ち回れるか―
というようなゲームですが、DRPG好きでアクションが特に苦手でない方は是非！

46.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2013
這是一款讓人玩了意猶未盡的遊戲，遊戲融合了傳統RPG迷宮，SLG戰棋，第一人稱加解謎等各種元素。玩家扮演四個因為重罪而被流放進入Grimrock這座高山的囚犯，山裡頭是十幾層的地牢，四人可扮演不同職業、種族同心協力戰鬥，並且不斷在地牢中找尋往下的樓梯，開啟無盡的機關，最後找到最底層逃出去的生路。遊戲戰鬥方式是即時的，如果你以為走走格子，砍砍敵人很簡單，那後面一定會讓你嚐到苦頭。因為第一人稱的關係，視野死角很多，走位也不容忽視。尤其遇到複數敵人時，腹背受敵，造成進無可進、退無可退的窘境就很容易被打死。地牢裡的怪物不算豐富，但每種怪物都很獨特，肯定讓你印象深刻。遊戲裡隱藏的寶物、開不了的門很多，需要動頭腦才能解開，也是我最喜歡玩的遊戲類型。
 
meme
5
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
45.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2020
Legend of Grimrock basicamente é um jogo pra você que está cansado da monotonia dos RPG's atuais.

Ele é um dungeon crawler 10/10

Traz MUITOS puzzles, mas diferente de alguns jogos do gênero, ele não se torna massante na dificuldade de resolução, mas sim MUITO prazeroso ao decifrar os inúmeros quebra cabeças que o game esconde.
Eu sou de 91 e cresci jogando Dragon quest, final fantasy e pokémon. o gameplay de Grimrock me remete ao lado bom das runs de Dragon Quest.
As batalhas são simples, mas a meu ver não são o ponto central. O inimigos são MUITO bonitos, realmente o cuidado dos desenvolvedores com os detalhes do jogo se mostra presente a cada andar novo sendo desbravado.
Apesar do cenário ir se repetindo ao longo do gameplay, ele não se torna cansativo, a repetição é bem distribuída, e como dito acima, os inúmeros puzzles e áreas secretas compensam essa repetição.
Fazia tempo que não sentia tanto prazer jogando um game, e esse simplesmente tomou minha atenção.

Se você leu essa review mas quer mais detalhes sobre como o game funciona. Me add ae bora trocar uma ideia que eu garanto que esse jogo vale a pena. E o preço em promo é maravilhoso.
 
KingSalame
