2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
124.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2015
Когда-то давно в детстве я рисовал на листах в школьных тетрадках лабиринты со всякими ловушками, секретами и наградами, затем брал игральные кубики от игры в нарды и играл. Было невероятно увлекательно!

К сожалению, я не играл в старенькие компьютерные игры, которые можно по праву назвать предшественниками Grimrock. Более того, я с детства не люблю компьютерные игры, в которых нужно убивать монстров и наблюдать перед собой всякие страшили вроде пауков, троллей и прочих созданий. Поэтому, увидев однажды на YouTube прохождение по этой игре, я посмотрел одну серию и бросил, решив, что в ЭТО я играть уж точно не буду... Однако позже, имея в своём распоряжении чуть больше времени, я посмотрел ещё несколько серий. И произошло странное дело - я втянулся. Более того - захотелось самому попробовать!..
Попробовал - и ещё больше втянулся. Настолько, что захотелось пройти ещё раз, но уже с другой командой и используя другую стратегию и тактику. Ради этого я решил приобрести эту игру здесь, в Steam.

Итак, что же мне понравилось в игре...
1. Красивая графика. У меня не очень мощная по нынешним меркам машина, но и то, что я увидел на своих средних настройках, меня впечатлило и понравилось.
2. Великолепный, потрясающий звук и музыка, которые создают невероятно классную атмосферу! Невероятно понравилась озвучка спецэффектов, магических заклинаний, повышения уровня и окружающей обстановки.
3. Очень хорошо передаваемая атмосфера игры. Особенно ярко это ощущается у меня, когда гаснет очередной факел и ты оказываешься в кромешной тьме в длинном и тёмном коридоре или на развилке, а со всех сторон тебя окружают странные и порой страшные звуки... Не добавляют оптимизма статуи и лежащие на полу останки, в которых иногда всё-таки приходится покопаться, чтобы достать что-то нужное или полезное.
4. Удобный интерфейс. Любое сражение один на один - это всего четыре клетки, квадрат 2х2. Нажать не на ту кнопку, конечно, можно случайно, но из-за этого не полетишь вверх торшмашками, как это бывает в симуляторах автогонок.
5. Интересные монстры, у каждого вида из которых есть свой искусственный интеллект. Признаться, я был несколько удивлён, когда открыл очередной тайник и на меня выскочили грибы. Как ни пытался я заставить их поодиночке выходить на бой - ни один не пришёл...
Вообще же, больше всего мне понравились грибы, огненные атронахи и колдуны-гороморги, хранители нижних ярусов горы. Сражения с ними доставили наибольшее удовольствие.
6. Великолепные, потрясающие головоломки и загадки, решать которые можно по-разному. Можно помечать все явные места с секретами, а потом открывать их на нижнем ярусе, а можно - что гораздо интереснее! - с криком бросаться вниз и попадать в какой-нибудь один из таких секретов, порой весьма неочевидных...
7. Отлично продуманная, на мой взгляд, ролевая система игры. Благодаря которой можно пройти игру несколько десятков раз, каждый раз при этом планируя разные методы развития своих персонажей. Которых тоже можно выбирать и комбинировать как угодно. Ну, например, сыграть четырьмя минотаврами или четырьмя магами.

Что не понравилось...
1. Головоломки на время с плитами и ловушками. Например, я свыше 50 попыток сделал, чтобы получить "Sword of Nex", но ни разу сделать это не удалось. Как и открыть железную дверь на 7-м ярусе...
2. Финальное сражение... Ужасно мрачное и хардкорное. Хотя, наверное, именно таким оно и должно было быть!..

**********
В любом случае хочу поблагодарить разработчиков этой игры за ту невероятную атмосферу и те долгие часы, проведённые за игрой. Очень бы хотелось пройти и вторую часть, но пока мне она, увы, недоступна. Ну что ж, есть повод поэкспериментировать в этой игре!..
 
Mug Ruith
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2022
Ich mag Dungeoncrawler.
Nein, das ist falsch. Ich mag die Idee von Dungeoncrawlern. Das liegt zunächst mal daran, dass ich das Genre um ein auf zwei Jahrzehnte verpasst habe und meine Schmerzgrenze, was alte Spiele angeht, bei meiner Sozialisierung mit diesen aufhört. Also irgendwo kurz vor der Jahrtausendwende.
Anyway, ich mag die Geschichten in Retropodcasts, wie Leute von Ordnern voll mit handgezeichneten Karten erzählen, ich mag das klare Regelsystem, nachdem Dungeons gebaut und durch sie navigiert wird und ich mag die minimalistische Fantasie: Hier ist ein Labyrinth, erforsche, erobere und plündere es.
Wow, das ist mal ein Intro. Insbesonders für eine negative Review.
Legend of Grimrock bedient dieses Konzept. Grimrock ist ein cooles Dungeon, Navigation dadurch fühlt sich so an, wie ich denke, dass es sich anfühlen muss. Ich mag wie das Spiel aussieht (und widerspreche damit den Stimmen in den Rezensionen, die es hässlich nennen), wie es mit Licht arbeitet und Geräuschen.
Wo es mich verliert sind die Kämpfe.
Legend of Grimrock ist ein Echtzeitspiel mit einem Echtzeitkampfsystem. Ich verstehe, dass es damit auf einer Linie im Genre mit einigen namenhaften Titeln aus den 80ern liegt. Ich verstehe nicht, wie man das anfang der Zehnerjahre, nachdem man das Konzept "Gamedesigne" erfunden hat, noch für eine gute Idee halten kann. Kämpfe in Grimrock sind darauf ausgelegt, dass man um Gegner herumtanzt, Zauber zusammenklickt (super cooles Konzept) und die Angriffe seiner Gruppe auslöst. Und das ist hektisch, globig und endet meistens in einer Sackgasse und mit freigelegter Backline.
Das ist halt super schade, weil Legend of Grimrock in allen anderen Bereichen sehr viel stärker ist als seine "aktuellen" (ich muss mir immer wieder vorhalten, dass das Ding mittlerweile 10 Jahre alt ist und einen Nachfolger hat. Aber in der Zeit ist ja auch nicht so viel in dieser Form passiert) Genremitbewerber mit (seien wir ehrlich, eher mittelmäßige) rundenbasierte Kämpfen.
Nichts desto trotz: Moderner Indieklassiker, keine Frage. Aber leider für mich gegatekeept.
 
Von Herbst

37.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2017
Хорошая игра, но...

Что-то намудрили разработчики со сложностью пазлов под конец. Буквально пролетел 8 уровней, собрал 90% секретов. И вдруг полный ступор на 9 уровне. Несколько потраченных часов и даже никаких идей, как пройти.

Боевка довольно простая. Видов врагов не так много и ни один не представляет никаких проблем. Можно любого врага убить хоть голыми руками, это лишь вопрос времени. Засады - единственные места, где можно умереть. Предсказать их невозможно, ты просто появляешься и тебя окружает толпа врагов.

Игра слишком понравилась, чтобы идти смотреть прохождение на ютубе, но тратить время и дальше на бесцельное скитание по подземельям не вижу смысла. Возможно я просто ретард, но тогда почему до этого ни один пазл не задерживал меня дольше минуты? Непонятно...

Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2014
This game is a blast. I've never been a fan of the square-by-square dungeon crawler game, but I LOVE Grimrock.
It's built on the mechanics of games like "Eye of the Beholder" But with a newer asthetic and tempo.
You really feel like you're on an epic adventure through an ancient labyrinth.

ALSO! When you're done with the main story, there is a wealth of excellent workshop content, and an editor so you can make your own.

Give this game a chance, you'll be glad you did.

Recommandé
30.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2016
Actualmente estoy en proceso de finalización de la segunda entrega, pero aunque todo el mundo lo prefiere a éste, yo discrepo. Éste es el verdadero núcelo del género, y aunque es cierto que el segundo es "más y mejor" en todo... no siempre más, es mejor.

Para empezar, la premisa de esta entrega me resulta mucho más atractiva. Los 4 miembros de tu party son unos criminales culpables de un delito desconocido, condenados a vagar por una montaña hasta que, o perezcan, o se ganen su libertad gracias a sus buenas gónadas. ¿De veras alguien podría preferir el "has naufragado, sal de ahí" que un máster novato le pone al lvl 1 de clérigo guerrero en una D&D a esto? Aquí la sensación de estar jodido es mucho más fuerte, confían tanto en que tu sentencia es la muerte que ni te encierran. Te sueltan y espabílate.

En el campo de lo jugable, ese juego tiene solo dos defectos, pero que todo el mundo ya ha enumerado. sus controles y su sistema de combate, pero coño, en este género esto siempre ha sido así. Son ortopédicos pero es que el género en sí ya es así, aquí no prima el grindeo ni una estrategia hiper depurada. Aquí debes explorar, tener vista, ser astuto, razonar, y todo eso se premia ♥♥♥ encuentros que te hacen lo bastante fuerte como para superar a cualquier enemigo. Teniendo claras sus prioridades, no veo su problema.

Además, las cosas como son. Superar sus retos uno tras otro produce un enorme subidón de ego. Y que nadie sea modesto, este juego nos lo da en bandeja si apreciamos sus mecánicas y logramos bailar a gusto ♥♥♥ él. Y nada sabe como eso.

Huele... a victoria.
 
Duffm@n

Recommandé
17.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2023
I went into this game expecting a slog with opaque puzzles and impossible fights. Instead I found a gem which rewards exploration and patience. I think there was only one non-secret room in the whole game where I felt like "this is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ if I didn't have these things on me, I would have spent hours backtracking", the rest of it was challenging but achievable. Don't get me wrong, you die many times, and save scumming is almost a requirement, but I never felt like my achievements came down to luck or pixel ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, and it gave me a satisfying feeling right until the end.

A note on exploration. One thing I despise but have come, in resignation, to expect from modern CRPGs, is the endless wasteland of nothing which those games provide for "exploration". This is why I am no longer a completionist when it comes to these kinds of games -- despite the fact that I love the joy of discovering something.

Why spend 300 hours looking through everything, doing every quest and exploring everywhere, when you can beat the game in less than 40 hours? The thing is that "discovering something" starts to lose meaning if that something is inconsequential to you beating the game or not.

But nothing is superfluous in this game. It is short yes, but it is long enough to provide a satisfying experience, and to encourage you to actually explore everywhere, look for secrets, read the scrolls, learn the mechanics, git gud at combat (which you can, once you learn a few tricks of the genre).

9.5/10. Comes so close to being perfect, but it's still better than most rpgs out there. Can't wait to play the sequel.
 
rrhvella

Recommandé
27.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2020
Legend of Grimrock is a modern "dungeon crawler" RPG, a throwback to a bygone era of gaming that did little in the way of hand-holding. The basic premise of the game is simple: lead your party through a complex series of maze-levels to defeat a boss and escape. The actually story isn't much more complicated: your party of "heroes" are marginally customizable RPG tropes that were imprisoned for some reason or another in a prison in some place or another by some corrupt group of people or another. To be honest, it's really hard to care about your party of characters, or the enemies. There just isn't that much to go off of. Unless you do what the art school witches do when they're not at play practice or on TikTok: use your imagination.

*Exception: This criticism doesn't apply to Toorum. Toorum is the realest MVP of this entire game. eh leaves helpful hints and supplies behind for your party of anons and doesn't afraid of anything.*

Seriously. Just imagine some scenario, some backstory, some family life, if you need to in order to care about your characters. But if you don't need to? Then just enjoy the challenging puzzles and maze exploration for what they are. Because to be honest, the puzzles and maze exploration in Legend of Grimrock are quite exceptional. They're difficult at times. Not quite Myst or Riven "What the ♥♥♥♥ does this lever do I've been stuck here for 3 hours?!" level of maddening, but they can be frustrating. There is a real sense of achievement when you finally solve the puzzle though. And it's in those moments where the game really shines.

Pros:
+ Great puzzle design
+ Great level design
+ Graphics/overall aesthetic are pleasant
+ Monsters are well-designed (exception: final boss)
+ Equipment and supplies are well-balanced
+ The Goromorgs are nightmare fuel. They're Lovecraftian.
+ It's a lovely homage to old school dungeon crawlers
+ I really, really mean the previous "pro" point. It does hit a ton of nostalgia triggers, and that's quite lovely especially right now around the holidays.

♥♥♥♥:
- I hated art school and don't like TikTok witches. I don't want to use my imagination to create my own reasons to care about my characters.
- Combat and skill progression could and should be a bit more involved and complex. (After a couple of hours, it gets really boring to just click a couple of buttons over and over again to defeat literally every enemy in the game except for the final boss.)
- And speaking of the final boss: um, excuse me, but what the hell? Who decided that this was who the mastermind behind the whole operation would be?
- The final cut scene is a series of like 5 or 6 stills and then a roll of credits. I guess it's to be expected of a small studio, and it's certainly indicative of the genre's ancient origins. But, I mean... this game came out in the 2010s. I really wanted more.

Score: 8.2 out of 10

A respectable B- that would have been a glowing A- if the final boss-slash-dungeon mastermind wasn't a damn... well, no spoilers this review. The big reveal was just a let down after such a grind.

I'd still recommend it though. And if anyone could let me know if some more world building and character development was done for the sequel, that would be great. Cheers, Big Ears.
 
Unrest
1,419 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
53.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2019
Excellent, challenging dungeon crawler in the vein of 'Dungeon Master' and 'Eye Of The Beholder'.

If 'Legend Of Grimrock' does anything right, it's this: It puts trust in the player's own intellect. So many games today are tutorial-driven dreck, with everything in them spelled out to the player in tiresome hand-holding, as if you were a toddler incapable of being left to your own devices. Or, the developers make the game so easy that it's a bore to play - a type of virtual kindergarten where everything is simplified and dumbed down for the lowest possible common denominator. 'Legend Of Grimrock' doesn't do that.

See a door you can't open? Every lock has it's own key - start looking for it. See a path you can't reach? You gotta solve the puzzle to reach it. Being reset by moving teleporters? Better memorize the patterns so you can make it past, because the game isn't going to do the work for you or offer you an easier path. In fact, the game has an old school mode that eliminates the automap feature, because the games that inspired it didn't have an automap. If you played those earlier games and wanted a map you had to draw it yourself.

The combat is also yours to figure out. The game is not going to suggest how to deal with the latest new enemy. It's not going to suggest a spell, a weapon, or a tactic for how to deal with any of the threats you encounter. It's not going to warn you about the sort of attacks the enemies have to throw against you like a mollycoddling jrpg. There are no gadgets to insta-kill tough creatures, no spells to see enemies through walls, no invincibility potions, no god-like powers with which to mow enemies down... it's just your meager party of puny, mortal hominids against a trap-filled labyrinth crawling with things that want to kill you, and can usually do so easily.

This game really scratched an itch I had for a long time. I wanted a modern game comparable to 'Eye Of The Beholder' and that is exactly what I got with 'Legend Of Grimrock'.

A few things I felt worth adding:

Some people have complained that there is a scarcity of food in the game. This is completely incorrect. There are food-dropping monsters that respawn in numerous parts of the dungeon, including the very last levels! Anyone that finds their party in want of food must be feeding their party when they don't actually need to eat. I had a surplus of edibles by the end of the game. *shrugs*

Some say the combat is easy because of square-dancing. Sure, on the enemies that tactic works on, and in areas of the game where that is possible, but not in narrow corridors, not when fighting multiple monsters, not during ambush events, and not when there are pits to fall into or traps killing you. The very last level in the game will drive this point home more than any other.

To be honest, the only issue I had with the game was the timed events that required a bit more dexterity with the keyboard than I was generally used to. One puzzle requires that you block a fairly long sequence of bolts with your "body". I kept failing the timing until I turned down the graphic settings and it became much more responsive (I turned off SSAO ). Late in the game there is a timed puzzle involving hitting switches while maneuvering around a pit-filled room. These sort of personal dexterity tests of the player are really annoying, but fundamentally doable with some persistence.

 
Servile_Misanthrope
503 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2016
Legend of Grimrock is a great example of an indie game that finds a niche that bigger devs and publishers have no interest in and does it well. It takes the gameplay of old dungeon crawlers like Dungeon Master and Eye of the Beholder and puts a nice coat of paint on them. It's surprising how well the idea holds up with only a few little quality of life improvements.

Of course, Grimrock isn't for everybody. Most people are probably going to find it a little tedious to slog through same looking hallways while having to save scum in case a monster closet opens up on them.The tile based movement and "click on a character portrait" combat is less than smooth, but if you're the kind of person who likes Resident Evil with tank controls than you probably understand how restrictive design can be a good thing sometimes. It creates a frantic combat atmosphere as you try to coordinate moving around with attacking while setting up rune combinations to cast spells.

For a certain kind of person, there's something engrossing about wandering lonely, abandonded hallways, solving puzzles and finding secret treasures. There's no soundtrack here, just the moan of an empty dungeon and the occasional skittering of an enemy that might be safely locked away or just around the corner waiting to pop out at you. There are no loot drops, if you want better weapons and armor you better make sure your puzzle solving is up to snuff as everything needs to be earned and a lot of things are squirreled away pretty deviously. Generally the game is pretty fair and you can get through with a minimum number of secrets found (I discovered a little over half) one puzzle that required backtracking for specific items that you might not think important to carry was annoying, but most puzzles that you need to solve to progress won't make you tear your hair out.

If you're interested it may be better to jump to Grimrock II, which I've heard improves a lot on the formula here, but on its own this is still a solid game and a unique experience if you're not familiar with this style of game.
 
Ed Rooney
476 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
12.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2012
If you like old-school party-based first-person dungeon crawling, you need to get Legend of Grimrock. It's chock-full of all the features you expect from that genre, plus an intuitive interface, excellent graphics (esp. for it being an indie game!), interesting spellcasting system, and even a hardcore mode that lets you play it like a truly old-school dungeon crawler.

Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2013
What can I say about Legend of Grimlock... Playing on computers since commodore 64 I have always loved games. One genre that sucked so much of my life away as a kid was dungeon crawlers. Floor after floor of single step adventure, never knowing when something will cross your path. The terror of when something is standing deep in that barely lit hall. Every step followed by theres until the faceoff tells who will step once more.

This games has it all wrapped in new beautiful graphics. EVERY thing that I loved, All that I hated. I highly recommend it to any fan of the old dungeon crawler genre. I might even go as far as saying you are doing yourself a disservice by bypassing this one.

Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2012
古き良きリアルタイム3DダンジョンRPGを、現代のテイストで見事に復活させた作品。リアルなグラフィックとシンプルなゲーム性は、ただひたすら潜ることだけに没頭させる。単純ながらも瞬時の判断や操作ミスが命取りとなる緊張感のある戦闘と、頭を悩ますダンジョンの謎と、閃きの褒美としての隠し部屋にアイテム。新しい武器や防具を装備した時の興奮は、地味で淡々とした探索の中で一際輝く。ボリュームは少なめだがそれ以上の密度と満足感を得られる無二の体験をすることが出来るだろう。

1,024 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
56.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2016
Legend of Grimrock aims to give players an old school dungeon crawl experience which harkens back the old Dungeon Master games, and it does an admirable job doing that. . Legend of Grimrock is a faithful addition to the genre, yet gives it a modern level of accessibility. This is a great dungeon crawler for new players to get introduced to the genre as well as for veterans to relive the nostalgic goodness of the old dungeon crawlers.

All the ingredients that made Dungeon Master so great are here. The game has a simplistic presentation on the surface, but with a fairly deep level of gameplay underneath. The party begins with nothing, and the player must explore the dungeon and find items that will help the party survive including weapons, armor, and even food. Everything takes place in real time where the player must click each party member’s action buttons for the party members to attack with either melee, ranged, or magic attacks. Starving characters take severe penalties on their ability to fight, and the food meter is always ticking. This gives some level of urgency to find food to keep your party effective throughout the game. The player can make the game as difficult as desired by options like increasing the power of monsters (mobs), turning on ironman mode, or even turning off auto-mapping and bringing out the graph paper (now that’s old school!).

Besides combat with the horde of mobs crawling around the multilevel dungeon, players will be engaged with the many puzzles obscuring the player from progression further into the dungeon or from finding the many secrets that the dungeon holds. The game does a decent job of rewarding the player for problem solving. There is always some hidden room or passage that may hold a useful item that will help the player. Item distribution and progression is somewhat flawed, though. You’ll often come across items that are obsolete the moment you find them because you found something much better already.

There are three classes to choose from (fighter, rogue, and mage). Each class has a unique set of skills that the player can spend skill points on to develop the characters. You can come up with some interesting builds that suit your playstyle. You can have characters specialize in certain melee weapons or ranged weapons, you can have characters play more defensive with skills such as armor and dodge, or you can also have characters specialize in unarmed combat for some “kung fu” action. The magic system may feel somewhat clumsy at first and takes some getting used to. It is faithful to an old school feel, though, and an interesting system that gets away from a mundane menu system that is typical of spell systems. There may be some balance issues that make some attributes and skills more desirable than others, but just about any build you can think of is viable enough to complete the game.

The visuals are what you’d expect from a dungeon crawler made in 2012. The ambient sounds, with the footsteps and growl of mobs on the other side of doors, walls, or around corners, create a spooky and claustrophobic atmosphere. It does a good job of immersing you in the dungeon and keeping an eye over your shoulder to make sure you’re not being creeped up on by anything.

This is a cool game that I highly recommend to anyone who is a fan of dungeon crawlers and especially the old Dungeon Master series. This is also a good introduction to dungeon crawlers for those new to them. Get this game.

A Warning to those who suffer from Arachnidphobia. The spiders in this game are creepy as hell.
 
Krayor Krelion
519 produits enregistrés
0

ironloofa1
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
44.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2018
Студия Almost Human решила создать что-то похожее на классические игры "Dungeon Master" и "Eye of the Beholder", и вышло у них весьма неплохо.
Играть вы будете за группу бедолаг - четверку заключённых, осуждённых за неназванные преступления. Осуждённым преступникам, несогласным с приговором, предлагают заслужить прощение. Для этого их отправляют в недра горы Гримрок. Но оттуда ещё никто не возвращался. Эту несправедливость и предстоит исправить вам, руководя группой персонажей и пройти по подземельям от вершины горы до её подножья.
Не думайте, что небольшой заставкой, рассказывающей о судьбе четверых пленников, принявших решение использовать свой последний шанс, сюжет и ограничивается. Хватает и тайн, головоломок и таинственных записок, проливающих свет на происходившие здесь события. Здесь работает так называемое повествование через окружение.
Вас сбрасывают в небольшую комнату. Осмотревшись вы найдёте полуистлевший скелет в углу и запертый решеткой выход из камеры. Отсюда и начинается ваше путешествие.
Но сама игра начинается немного раньше - с формирования отряда. Можно выбрать стандартный набор героев, а можно составить свою команду: доступны три класса и четыре расы. Особенности рас заточены под конкретные профессии: минотавры - хорошие воины, люди-ящеры - ловкие воры, гуманоидные насекомые - способные волшебники, люди - мастера на все руки. При желании можно выбрать портреты персонажей. Вообще то, есть ещё один секретный персонаж - Торум, смесь мага и воина. Сыграть за него (ваша группа будет состоять только из него одного и никак иначе) вы сможете только при повторном прохождение, и при выполнении определённого условия. Если вы играете в первый раз лучше ограничьтесь классической группой - два воина спереди, вор и маг сзади. Но если вы уже искушённый игрок, то можете попробовать группу из четырёх магов, или четырёх воров. Даже такие необычные группы в умелых руках могут не то что жизнеспособны, но и превзойти стандартную группу по боеспособности.
В последствии вы сможете развивать своих героев как душе угодно (в рамках своего класса конечно), что даёт большой простор для вашей фантазии. Можете вложить очки опыта в умение носить броню без штрафа (что полезно для воинов). Для воинов есть несколько веток умений для использования различного оружия ближнего боя (можно сражаться даже голыми руками). Самое быстрое оружие ближнего боя - это меч. Но и разовый урон у него меньше. Следующим по скорости идут топоры - мощнее, но медленнее. И самое медленное, но чрезвычайно мощное - булавы. Но при их использовании добавляется ещё штраф к точности, поэтому промахиваться вы будете частенько. Для вора вы тоже можете выбрать несколько вариантов развития. Можете сделать его несравненным мастером кинжалов, стрелком (лук или арбалет) или научить обращаться с метательным оружием (камни, метательные ножи, сюрикены, метательные топоры). У мага всё проще и у вас на выбор есть 4 школы магии - огня, льда, земли и воздуха. Рекомендую не распалятся, а выбрать одну-две школы магии и развивать их.
Перемещение происходит дискретно - строго по квадратным тайлам. Зажав правую кнопку мыши, вы можете осматриваться как душе угодно, а не только по четырём сторонам. Перемещаетесь вы не каждым персонажем по отдельности, а всем отрядом - два героя спереди, два сзади. Менять персонажей местами можно, а иногда даже и необходимо. Из заднего ряда нельзя атаковать оружием ближнего боя (на самом деле можно, но, если изучите соответствующий навык), исключение составляют только копья. Для заднего ряда есть магия, метательное оружие, луки и арбалеты.
Магия, которой вы сможете пользоваться представляет собой различные заклинания. Есть четыре стихии школы магии - огонь, лёд, земля и воздух. Любое заклинание складывается из комбинации нескольких рун (всего их 9). Их можно узнать из специальных свитков, найденных во время путешествий по подземельям. Чтобы прочесть и использовать заклинание нужны определённые умения и мана. Но и без свитка можно найти нужную комбинацию рун эмпирическим путём. Атакующие заклинания преобладают, но есть и такие, которые применяются для защиты и облегчения боя с врагами - "заморозка" врага или невидимость всего отряда.
Сражения, как и всё остальное в игре, происходят в реальном времени. Но атакуют наши персонажи по очереди - после удара герою требуется передышка. Поэтому определённая сноровка тут пригодится - чем быстрее вы сможете атаковать всеми героями по очереди, тем лучше.
Одна из самых выгодных тактик боя это найти квадрат, размером не меньше 2х2 клетки, и на нём сражаться с противником, уходя в сторону от его атак. Желательно с одним за раз, иначе есть большой шанс что вас окружат.
Также в игре очень много всевозможных загадок. Находить решения некоторых строго обязательно - без этого не продвинуться дальше по сюжету. Другие можно оставить позади, но лучше этого не делать. Чаще всего за успешную разгадку отряд будет достойно вознаграждён - хорошая экипировка и полезные вещи никогда не повредят. Ценное снаряжение хранится за железными дверями (коих их в игре 10). К каждой такой двери нужны специальные ключ. Их в игре ровно столько-же. Но самое ценное хранится в сокровищницах. Всего есть 3 сокровищницы. в каждой из них по три двери. То есть 9 дверей всего. Но ключей для них в игре всего 3. То есть выбирать вам придётся тщательно, на всё ключей не хватит.
В игре нужно следить не только за уровнем здоровья персонажей, но и за их сытостью. Голодные персонажи получают дебафы. Если на первых уровнях еды будет воз и маленькая тележка, то чем глубже вы будете спускаться, тем меньше будете её находить.
Сон тоже играет немаловажную роль. Он не только ускоряет время, тем самым давая восполнить шкалы здоровья и маны персонажей без томительного ожидания, но и позволяет время от времени видеть сны - сюжетные вставки в которых некая сущность будет пытаться заручится вашей помощью, и обещать помочь в ответ. Но помните, что во сне ваши персонажи и проголодаются быстрее. Помимо сна, здоровье и ману можно восстановить, прикоснувшись к Кристаллам жизни (заодно и игра сохранится). Кристалл после этого на некоторое время потухнет, но вы сможете воспользоваться им позднее. Также здоровье и ману можно восстановить, выпив соответствующее зелье. Зелья можно находить, а можно и варить самому. Для этого вам понадобится ступка с пестиком (найдёте в конце второго уровня) и пустой стеклянный флакон. Флаконов вы найдёте за всю игру крайне мало (хорошо, что при использовании зелья флакон просто опустошается и его можно использовать заново), поэтому про запас наварить зелий не удастся. В некоторых ситуациях вероятнее всего придётся заниматься эти даже посреди боя. Свитки с рецептами зелий вы также, как и свитки с заклинаниями будете находить в ходе игры. Но, как и в этом случае, рецепт вы можете подобрать наугад.

Плюсы:
Приятная графика, несмотря на скромный "вес" игры;
Интересные и запутанные загадки;
Разнообразная боевая система;
Отлично переданная атмосфера подземелья.

Минусы:
Скудный сюжет;
Местами не очень удобное управление;
Не всегда удобно поднимать с пола предметы.
 
Sirin6841
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
113.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2015
リアルタイム３Dダンジョン探索ゲー
腹が減ったり、アイテムを取るためにわざと落とし穴に落ちたり、壁を凝視しながら横移動したりするゲーム

昔のゲームを詳しく知らない私は「リアルタイムWizardry」っていう第一印象だったのだけど、「ダンジョンマスター」っていうまんまこのゲームと同じシステムのゲームがあったらしい
わりと人気だったが同じようなシステムのゲームが無い現代にダンジョンマスターが蘇った、的な感じのがこのLegend of Grimrock

ダンジョン(暗い屋内)を探索するゲームなので光源を得ながら移動する必要がある
視界は広くなく遠くは暗い。曲がり角も豊富なので急にモンスターが目の前に出てくることもある
罠が目の前で作動したりすると結構おどろく

音もなかなか恐怖を煽ってくる
クモやオーガが目視できないのに足音が聞こえてくると緊張感がある
扉をおろした時の衝撃音がうるさい
スイッチを押した後に扉が開く音が遠くから聞こえてくることもあるので音を頼りに開いた扉を探す必要も出てくる
そういうわけで音も探索に重要な要素なのでそれを邪魔するBGMなどは流れません

視覚でも聴覚でもダンジョンの危なさを演出してくるのは優秀
ただ壁や床の見た目が似ているので自分が今どこにいるか迷うこともある
それもダンジョン探索の一興といえば一興

基本的に最上階から最下階を目指すゲーム
ゲームクリアに必須ではない謎解きが多い
隠し部屋を見つければ見つけるだけアイテムが揃って旅路が楽になる
 
Holly＿Utty
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
32.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2017
Absolutely solid game for that Eye of the Beholder/Dungeon Master itch!

It's been made by a team of 4 people and you notice that. The variety of environments and monsters is not too high, but the level layouts keep everything fresh. Especially noteworthy in my opinion are the puzzles, there's a ton of them and they kept being interesting and creative.

Massively enjoyed playing this game!
 
TrixieButtons

Recommandé
30.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2013
Коротко и по делу:
- Отличное возвращение к класическому геймплею времён игр меч магии
- Чудесные загадки, которых сейчас в рпг попросту нет (от подмена предметов на алтаре, чтобы тебя не убил гром и нахождения скрытых кнопок в стенах, до бесконечного корридора)
- Олдскульная, но доступная прокачка
- Многоуровневые подземелья. Привет первой дьябле.
- Увы, в подземелье вы не встретите других людей. Это конечно не сказать, что минус, но хотелось бы встретить хоть кого то, кроме записок выживающего заключённого.
- Сюжета нет. Хоть и есть свитки о том зачем строилась это гора и как выживал в ней один заключённый, а так же голос, слышимый героми во сне. Вроде как интрига об этой горе есть, но хотелось бы чтобы её раскрыли больше.
- Картинка очень крута для инди проекта.
- Олдскул режим. Для ценителей, таких как я, это просто сказка. Готовьтесь запоминать локацию без всяких карт или же начинайте чертить их сами, как когда то давно.

Решайте сами стоит ли брать. Я, после 26 часов игры, не пожалел о потраченных деньгах.
 
Jackie
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2022
Fantastisches Spiel, dass an die wirklich guten alten Zocker-Zeiten erinnert. Habe einige Male fast aufgegeben, hätte manchmal den Designern sogar gerne einen Feuerball verpasst... umso größer war aber die Freude, als ich manch ewiges Rätsel dann doch noch geknackt habe. Ja, habe an zwei Stellen nach der Lösung im Netz geguckt - ärgere mich jetzt aber darüber, denn mit etwas Nachdenken, wenn man die Augen offen hält und wenn man sein Zeug schön ordnet, ist das auch ohne Fusch machbar. Man sollte es beim ersten Durchgang vielleicht doch erst mal auf "leicht" spielen.

36.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2019
謎解き重視の3DダンジョンRPG。
柵越しに気になるアイテムが見えてるけどどうやって行くんだろう、
といったタイプの謎解きが結構多いのでモチベーションを維持しやすいのが良いポイント。
クリアに必須な謎解きの難易度は低めですが、終盤に一部かなり難しい謎解きがあるため
そこで詰まるかもしれません。私はそこだけ調べました。
戦闘面ではリアルタイムで敵が行動するため、
移動や攻撃は結構正確かつ素早い操作が求められるバランスとなっています。
日本語非対応ですが、普通にプレイする分にはそこまで高度な英語能力は要らないと思います。

Recommandé
41.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2019
Per chi come me è ormai un non più giovane scoprire (nonostante lo abbia scoperto a distanza di anni dalla sua uscita) una chicca come questa non è da poco.
Qualche tempo fa rimuginavo ♥♥♥ nostalgia il buon vecchio "Dungeon Master" per Amiga... forse il primo vero RPG in real time che io abbia giocato... simulavo addirittura il multiplayer giocando al telefono (♥♥♥ cornetta e filo, internet come la conosciamo era ben lontana) ♥♥♥ un mio amico e percorrendo gli stessi corridoi...
Spinto dalla curiosità nel cercare le vecchie recensioni delle vecchie riviste cartacee riportate online mi sono imbattuto in questo gioco che veniva lodato come erede spirituale del genere...
Che dire... MAGNIFICO! E' una rivisitazione appunto di vecchie glorie come Dungeon Master o Eyes of the Beholder... (per chi sa ovviamente di cosa parlo).
Personalmente mi sta piacendo moltissimo... ovviamente lo stile di gioco è MOOOOLTO vecchia scuola... quindi probabilmente molti dei più giovani storceranno il naso e lo troveranno legnosissimo paragonato ai ben più moderni ed attuali rpg.
Io in ogni caso lo consiglio... è veramente una perla rara, soprattutto per chi come me ha vissuto quel periodo in piena giovinezza!

Évaluation publiée le 9 février 2019
This game was awesome. Took me a minute to get used to this style of controls and fighting, but once I got that down I had a lot of fun playing and working on the puzzles and searching for secrets on each level. Honestly had to look online a number of times or I'd never get through parts of this game, some of the solutions would have just taken too long or I just would not have ever figured them out, but nevertheless having played it through L.O.G. is now one of my favorite games ever. Well worth buying and getting to the end, not an extremely complex plot, but it doesn't need one when you are focused on the dungeon levels more, upgrading characters stats and equipment, and solving your way down, exploring and opening each floor, timing your movements for puzzles and fight strategies and figuring out how you will continue to survive, whether its keeping up on food for the party or how to get past deadly enemies. 10/10

Recommandé
42.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 janvier 2017
Legend of Grimrock jest grą specyficzną. Jednocześnie jest to typowy przedstawiciel swojego gatunku, ale tak dobrze wykonany i przemyślany, że trudno tą pozycję ominąć obojętnie.
W grze wcielamy się w postać lub drużynę i mamy do przejści labirynt naszpikowany pułapkami i przeciwnikami. Po drodze zdobywamy doświadczenie i niezbędny ekwipunek. Całość jest prosta i przejrzysta co pozwala skupić się na eksploracji i rozwiązywaniu łamigłówek. A te są naprawdę dobrze pomyślane.
Fabuła w grze jest opowiadana w formie snów i rzadko spotykanych notatek. Jest ciekawa, a finałowy boss potrafi zaskoczyć ;)
Motyw przewodni w menu jest rewelacyjny, ale na tym muzyka w grze się praktycznie kończy. Nie przeszkadza to w żadnym razie. Dźwieki wydawane przez potwory czy mechanizmy, zapadnie, kraty często subtelnie dają do zrozumienia co nas czeka lub co mamy wykonać, żeby przejść dalej, więc słuchanie przydaję się tutaj dosyć często.
Podsumowując, poleciłbym zagrać osobom, które nie szukają niesamowitych efektów i szybkiej akcji, bo pomimo braku tych czynników, Legend of Grimrock sprawia niesamowitą satysfakcję przez znajdywanie nowych sekretów i przechodzenie kolejnych poziomów.
 
SzuvaxG

Recommandé
50.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game was gifted to me and it surprised me alot. I think if I hadn't recieved this as a gift i wouldn't have ever found it otherwise. I have always loved dungeon crawlers, but never have I played a dungeon crawler that has the classic tiled/walled in area before. It's built like a old game but feels new. The graphics are great for that game and it should be able to run on almost any low end computer. The game mechanics are easy to learn and pick up, while still having you feel challenged and learn new methods of attacking and defending yourself. You will only get into this game if you play for at least an hour and pace yourself don't rush it. The puzzles are very difficult and sometimes very easy, this causes the players who take more time to think through a particular puzzle to be granted with better rewards. there are many sweet items i found on my second playthrough and it kept me searching for new ones. The story keeps you engaged and the ending couldn't have been made any better. The achievements took me a couple extra times to play/find online in order to achieve. I think this game is worth full price and you should get it if you want a whole new kind of game. There aren't many of these types of games out there and this one truly revived the classic dungeon crawler. You shouldn't hesitate if you are interested at all. Now off to Grimrock 2! Thanks for buying this game for me @Sven :)
 
AstroBorne
0

Recommandé
55.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2016
Özet

Birinci şahıs bakış açılı kafes sistemli oyunların günümüz görselliği ile güzelce süslenmiş, sıra tabanlı savaş sistemi yerine aksiyonu temel alarak -sanırım- farklı bir şeyler denemeye çalışmış ve kısmen başarılı olmuş bir oyundur. Zorluk ayarlarındaki düşman hasarı dengesizliği, hasar almadan erişilmeyen gizli bölgeler, rahatsız edici fazlalıkta düşman baskını içeren tuzaklar, büyü parşömenlerin düzensiz gelişi ve büyü çeşitliliğinin azlığı sebepleriyle oynaması yorucu olabiliyor. Hem zindanın dar koridorlarının gerginliğini hem de bolca gizlilik ile doldurulmuş bulmacaları çözmenin mutluluğunu başarılı bir şekilde veriyor. Son olarak da basit senaryosu ve tek bölüm sonu düşmanı savaşıyla tadı damakta kalıyor.

Lands of Lore gibi sıra tabanlı savaş sistemini içeren oyunları sevenler için hayal kırıklığı olabilir ama bu türden bir oyunu ilk defa deneyecek oyuncular için kesinlikle önerilir.

Kılıç, Taş ve Büyü!

Oyunun başında isteğe bağlı dört karakter yaratabiliyoruz. Eğer az karakterle oynamayı planlıyorsanız, düşmanların verdiği tecrübe puanında değişim olmadığını aklınızda bulundurun. Seçebildiğimiz dört ırk bulunuyor. Her ırk farklı istatistiğe sahip. Örneğin böcek ırkı zeka puanı yüksek iken Minator ırkının ise güç puanı yüksektir. Seçebildiğimiz dövüşçü, izci ve büyücü olarak üç sınıf var. Her sınıfın kendine ait yetenek ağacıyla birlikte ırklarda olduğu gibi istatistik puanı da değişiyor. Her sınıfın altı yetenek ağacı bulunuyor. Yetenek ağaçlarına verdiğiniz puanlar genel olarak sağlık, enerji ve istatistik puanı olarak geri dönüyor. Her altı veya yedi puanda bir ise özellik açılıyor. Silah yetenek ağaçlarında enerji karşılığında kullanılabilir ardışık, sersemleten, kanatan veya iten saldırılar bulunuyor. Bazı durumlarda ise her iki ele silah almak, aynı anda iki obje atabilmek veya tek seferde iki ok atabilmemizi sağlıyor. Savunmada ise zırhların getirdiği kaçınma puanı zaafını ortadan kaldırıyor. Büyülerde ise büyü kullanmamız için gerekli. Yetenek ağacına karma puanlar vererek karakteri geliştirmek en uygunu. Tek yetenek ağacını geliştirdiğiniz takdirde karakter çok fazla hasar verebiliyor ama çok zayıf kaldığı için hemencecik ölebiliyor. Özellikle dövüşçü yaptığım karakterlerde yaşadığım yetersiz kaçınma puanından dolayı savaşların çoğu uğraştırıcıydı. Savunması yüksek ve ağır zırh giyme imkanı olsa da oyunun zorluk ayarlarındaki dengesizlikten dolayı birazcık kaçınma puanı gerekli.

Yakın mesafede kılıç, balta, çekiç, bıçak, mızrak ve yumruklarımız var. Uzak mesafeden ise atabileceğimiz bolca taş, bıçak ve yıldız bıçağı bulunuyor. Yay ile kundaklı yayı da unutmamak gerek. Ayrıca arka sırada duran karakterlerinizin cephaneliği bitmesi durumunda mızrak ile uzak erişimli saldırılar yapabilirsiniz. Büyülere gelirsek çeşidi çok az, gücü fazla ve bulması zor. Ustası olabileceğimiz dört element var ve her element de yaklaşık dört çeşit büyü var. İkisi savunma ikisi saldırı. Büyü kullanacağımız vakit etkileşim ekranında belirli bir dizilimi hızlıca tuşlayıp aktif etmemiz gerek. Büyüleri deneme yanılmayla keşfedebiliyoruz ama ilk büyüler dışında keşfetmesi bir hayli zor. Diğer yöntem ise zindan boyunca karşımıza çıkan parşömenlerde yazıyor ama parşömenlerin geliş dizilimi ve karakterimizin kullandığı büyü tipi zıt olunca büyücü karakter oyunun ilk çeyreği hiçbir şey yapamıyor. Siz yine de bir tane büyücü bulundurun.

Genellikle savaşlar saldır, kaç, pozisyon al ve tekrar saldırmaktan ibaret. Savaşları çeşitli kılan şey ise savaş alanını doğru okumak ve tuzaklara dikkat etmekte. Düşmanların büyük çoğunluğu hareket ettikten sonra yüzünü döndüğü için teke tekte tehlikeli değiller. Genelde iki taneden fazla düşman, koridor veya ani düşman baskınları tehlike oluşturuyor. Eğer hareket edebildiğiniz alanı kaybetmediyseniz savaşlar sizin için iyiye gidiyor demektir. Köşeye sıkıştıysanız genelde iki karakterinizin ya da tüm takımınızın ölümüyle sonuçlanabilir.

Ah şu bulmaca ve gizlilikler...

Oyunda gözle görülür platform ve tuşlar dışında bir de duvara ait kırık bir taş parçası gibi görünen gizemli tuşlar var. Alt zindanlarda daha farklı şekillerde karşımıza çıkıyor ve bunlardan bolca bulunuyor. Kimisi gizlilikleri açarken kimisi ilerlememiz gereken yolda sırf biz görmeyelim diye konulmuş. Bazı gizlilikler zamanlama ve biraz da harita kontrolüyle keşfetmesi farklı bir tat veriyor. Bazen farkında olmadan gizliliklere ulaşılsa da oyun güzelce ödüllendiriyor. Araştırmadığınız zaman karakterler çıplak kalıyor. Silah, zırh ve büyü bakımından ahım şahım bir çeşitlilik olmasa da yeterli denilebilir.

Bulmacalar ise cidden üzerinde düşünülmüş ve haritaya güzelce serpiştirilmiş. Bazı bulmacalar ipucu olmaksızın çözülmüyor veya ulaşılmıyor. Bazı bulmacalar ise çok basit kelime oyunlarından oluşuyor. Bulmacaların genellikle çözümü ise bulmacadan istenen eşyayı yerleştirmek veya fırlatmaktan ibaret. Bazen devrik veya şiirsel olması bu işi zorlaştırıyor. Özellikle son seviyelerdeki bulmacaların bir kaçını anlaması oldukça zor, neyse ki tek tük var.

Bulmaca ve gizliliklerde ki sorunlardan biri, birkaç kat önceki bulduğunuz bir kağıdın bulunduğunuz bölgenin nasıl ilerlendiğini gösteren ipucu olması. O yüzden ipucu olduğunu düşündüğünüz -genellikle devrik cümleler içeren- kağıtları toplayın ve daha işe yaramayacağını düşündüğünüzde tek bir yerde toplayıp yere bırakın. Haritada üzerine not düşmeyi sakın unutmayın. Aynı şeyleri eşyalar içinde yapmanız önerilir. Son katlara doğru bir kaç eşyanın zorunluluğu sebebiyle önceki katlarda eşya aramaya girişebilirsiniz. O yüzden eşyaları olabildiğince toplayıp bir yere bırakın ve haritada not koyun ki rahatça bulabilesiniz.

Senaryo nasıl desem...

Ben oyunu iki kez bitirdim. İlk bitirdiğimde senaryo yazılarına odaklanmamış ve kafamda bir yere oturtmamıştım. İkinci defa oynadığımda ise aslında çokta önemi olmadığını anladım. Kısa, öz ve atmosferiyle tamamlayan basit bir senaryosu var. Dört suçluyuz, bulutları aşan bir dağın tepesinde bulunan çukurun içine atılıyoruz, hayatta kalır ve dağdan çıkarsak hayatlarımız bize geri veriliyor ya da hayatımızı hak ediyoruz. Zindanın kendine has ufak bir geçmişi ve en derininde ilginç bir gizem bizi bekliyor. Zindanda aşağı katlara indikçe ve "dinlenme" eylemini gerçekleştirdikçe gizemli bir güç bizimle iletişime geçiyor. Bir de bizim gibi zindanlarda daha önce bulunmuş "Toorum" adında bir adamın notları sayesinde bazı gizliliklere ve ipuçlarına ulaşıyoruz. Gizemli güç nedir ve ne yapmak istediğini zamanla Grimrock dağının derinlerine indikçe keşfediyoruz.

Menü Müziği ve Değerlendirme!

Oyunda menü müziği dışında hiçbir müzik yok. Zindanın daraltıcı atmosferini veren gürültüler ve sarsıntılar dışında sessizlik hakim. Şahsen menü müziği o kadar güzel ki her dinlediğimde tekrar başlama isteği doğuyor. Oyun, tekrar oynanacak içeriğe sahip ama farklı heyecanlar arayanlar olursa diye oyunun zorluğunu arttırıp "Old School" seçeneğini seçerek kareli defterinizde zindanın haritasını çizebilirsiniz.

Ah! Oyunda tek bölüm sonu düşmanı olduğundan bahsetmedim. Bu konunun üzücü olduğunu kabul ediyorum ama o tek bölüm sonu düşmanı savaşının da güzel olduğunu belirteyim. Keşfetmesi, araştırması ve bulmacaları çözmesiyle bu oyun benim için son derece keyifli bir deneyimdi. Bu türe ilgisi olanları belki tatmin etmeyebilir ama benim gibi yeni başlayan veya meraklısı olan herkese öneririm.

Puanım 80/100

Ufak Gizlilik Notu: Toorum'un kemiklerini bulduğunuzda, kemikleri kayıt kristalinde kullanarak Toorum ile oynama gizliliği açabilirsiniz. Toorum'un kemiklerini kristale koyduktan sonra yeni bir oyun açarak ilk karakterin adını "Toorum" yapınca, Toorum ile oynamaya başlayabilirsiniz.
 
Duşakabin Adam
460 produits enregistrés

Great looking oldschool-like Dungeon RPG with grid based movement. Quite nice skill tree system, puzzles. I really enjoyed this game. Fighting system has pretty interesting mechanics also, like sidesteping or swaping positions inside your party to reach enemies with shorter weapons (swords etc.).

Recommandé
38.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2016
You know how sometimes people try to remake or update or mondernize something and they fail miserably? Like e.g. trying to remake Total Recall or Conan the barbarian or trying to modernize Simon the sorcered (as in 3D) or reimagining Star Trek?

Well... this is NOT like that. This is more something like... get The Elder Scrolls 1 and 2 and rebuild them wiith Skyrim's engine sort of thing.

If you like dungeon crawlers of the Eye of the Beholder flavor, Lands of Lore flavor, Bard's Tale flavor (you get the idea) then you will lose it with this one because it is one of those games, built for modern machines. The gameplay is identical and this is a HUGE pro.

Do NOT skip this game . It is absolutely fantastic.
 
ZeuS

7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2016
Hej ty! Zaczekaj chwilę, wydaje mi się że szukasz przygód? Dobrze trafiłeś, Legend of Grimrock w świetnej oprawie graficznej, milionami korytarzy i tonami przeciwników, wita spragnionych świetnych wrażeń przygody śmiałków.
Myślisz ze dasz sobie radę? Pamietaj, że lochy nie obejdą sie bez pułapek, zagadek logicznych i ukrytch skarbów.
Gra lubi nagradzać za spostrzegawczość i exploring. Możesz stworzyć swoją drużyne, maga, strzelca, wojownika wybór zależy od ciebie, jak będzie ona wygladać. Ale to koniec wskazówek, idź po herbatkę i przekąski i biegnij pisać swoją historie w świecie Legend of Grimrock. Polecam!
 
Asimovsky
344 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2016
Recently, I've played a bunch of puzzles games and a good friend told me to play Grimrock because of the puzzles... But to me, it was mostly the gameplay that I really liked about this one. I really loved fighting in this game. It started so slow. I wasn't even sure I was liking it at first, but after an hour or so. Bam. I was in. I was in it for good. Nothing else really interested me. All I wanted was to level up, gain abilities, gear my characters, kill more stuff, walk further, discover more secrets, and of course get confused by the puzzles.

Grimrock is a perfect example of a typical indie game that takes an old 90's (even maybe late 80's) gameplay design and redo it in our modern era. It is kind of a slow game. Every time you move is tile by tile and when you attack or so you click on the attack, do it on front of you, wait for the cooldown and repeat. But in the end, it's only like if it would be a turn based combat system, but sometimes, you can get a turn faster than your opponent. Also, it gets pretty hard. You can facetank the first level or 2 but the gameplay gets pretty crazy pretty fast. You discover new types of weapons and new monsters. You have to kite them in order to survive. They are hard. You have to act fast and think fast too. You are not always fighting in the same environment. It's a really great mechanic. Any limitations you may have, the monsters have them too. You have to learn their pattern, and execute yours.

There is just so much stuff to discover. The whole world is begging you to find the hidden stuff everywhere. You will have to face really hard puzzles just to keep going on the main tract. They always comes with clues, so it's really fair. But some of them are really obnoxious and if you are not in it for the puzzles, you might want to consider looking for a guide. Or maybe just relax and take notes for an hour or two because some of the puzzles really require you to do so.

It might be a good idea to look for character guides too before starting to play. The way you build and play your character really matters. Like you might completely ruin your run if you put stats in stuff you end up not using. The game gets pretty hard later. You have to have good gear and especially specialized characters. So if you consider playing, but you only have time for 1 playthrough. Do a bit of research, look out recommendations, and get the game because it is really fun to play.

I give it 8/10. I can't wait to play the second one !
 
Aduleten
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2016
Dungeon Crawler inspirado en Eye Of The Beholder y la Saga Might and Magic.Una auténtica experiencia Old School,duro y exigente,no se anda ♥♥♥ tonterías.El combate parece por turnos,pero en realidad es en tiempo real ♥♥♥ enfriamiento de la habilidad de golpear,muy estratégico y además te permite esquivar por el mapeado mientras combates.
Lo más relevante son sus mapeados nada lineales,laberínticos al más puro estilo Might and Magic,y la gran cantidad de puzzles que hay,a cada paso.
En definitiva,un gran homenaje a los clásicos.

Si echas de menos los Eye of the Beholder, o incluso el Bloodwitch si eres más viejuno, esta es la cura a tu nostalgia.

Niveles y niveles de mazmorras que poder dibujar en papel cuadriculado como en los 90, enemigos solos o en grupos de 4 a los que rodear y disparar de lejos, gestión de inventario y de comida entre los 4 miembros de tu expedición. 4 miembros porque no todos somos el dragonborn, algunos necesitamos ayuda para acabar nuestra misión.

En resumen, toda la nostalgia de los RPGs de los 90 ♥♥♥ un aspecto más actual.

31.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2013
Un gran título. Rol del clásico basado en la exploración de mazmorras, ♥♥♥ muchos puzzles para resolver y movimiento por cuadrículas en tiempo real, en el que llevamos un grupo de 4 personajes que podemos crear a nuestro antojo y donde la colocación de estos es vital para lograr la mayor eficiencia en el combate además de la supervivencia del equipo. Cuenta ♥♥♥ una ambientación muy lograda, tanto en el aspecto sonoro como en iluminación, haciéndose necesario el buen uso de las antorchas. Gráficamente está diseñado ♥♥♥ mimo y no defrauda en ningún momento en este apartado. La banda sonora es escasa pero potente y de gran calibre. Antes de que nos demos cuenta estaremos tarareándola sin remedio.
Lo recomiendo completamente, tanto para los amantes de los clásicos del buen rol en mazmorras, como a los que se aventuren por primera vez en este tipo de juegos. No se arrepentirán... y el precio es de risa para lo que ofrece...que es mucho, y de paso apoyamos a esta gente para la segunda parte que se encuentra actualmente en desarrollo y tiene muy buena pìnta... Es una joya que no puedes dejar pasar. Saludos.

0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
39.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2013
FANTASTIC GAME

LEGEND OF GRIMROCK IS AN OLD SCHOOL RPG DUNGEON CRAWLER, IN THE VIEN OF DUNGEON MASTER AND EYE OF THE BEHOLDER.

IF YOU ARE AN OLD SCHOOL DUNGEON CRAWLER, YOU WILL LOVE THIS GAME, YOU CAN SET IT TO "OLD SCHOOL MODE" TO DISABLE AUTO-MAPPING WHICH FORCES YOU TO EITHER MAKE YOUR OWN MAPS OR GO IN BLIND.

THE STORY OF THE GAME, THOUGH FAIRLY BASIC, IS GOOD, AND GIVES YOU A REASON TO WANT TO FINISH IT.

ONCE YOU FINISH THE MAIN DUNGEON, MOUNT GRIMROCK, YOU CAN DOWNLOAD VARIOUS OTHERS EASILY THROUGH STEAM, MANY OF THESE ARE FAITHFUL RECREATIONS OF OLDER GAMES, OR NEW ADVENTURES ENTIRELY.

YOU CAN ALSO MAKE YOUR OWN DUNGEONS, WHICH OTHER PEOPLE CAN PLAY..

nOtE: yOu cAn MaKE cUstOm ParTieS , YOU CAN ALSO IMPORT CUSTOM PORTRAITS TO USE, so you can play with CHUCK NORRIS ETC.......

YOU CAN ALSO IMPORT PARTIES FROM YOUR OTHER DUNGEONS AND PLAY AS THEM IN DIFFERENT DUNGEONS.

--{[:RAMBLING, INCONSESSANT REVIEW, OVER:]}--


great game, must play

8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2013
If you have fond memories of crowding around an Amiga with mates playing RPGs with a pen and paper in hand then LoG will definitely scratch that itch. It's ultimately a shallow experience in that the rogue-like elements never truly change the gameplay and the interface, though simple, isn't particularly fun to use.

On sale it was a no-brainer. At full price, get it only if it's really your thing, otherwise wait until it's on sale.

925 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
98.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2012
Legend of Grimrock should be seen as definitely proof that Finns are actually good for something despite their well known insanity, or perhaps because of it.

Legend of Grimrock is a throwback to the core of the RPG genre. Stat based dungeon crawling. No mouse twitching skills required. No pseudo-choices that have no gameplay effects. No dialog pretending to be grey.

This is pure RPG gameplay. You create your party and fight through a dungeon of monsters finding new equipment and leveling up their skills and stats as you go along.

Despite the fairly oldschool grid based gameplay it is a pretty game, with good sounds, great exploration, hard to find secrets and frustrating puzzles. The combat might seem simple from the outside but movement will play a major part in the harder battles and particularly on the harder difficulties.

If there was something bad to say about this game it was a relatively short main campaign but the addition of Steam Workshop fixed that.

A great buy.
 
c00lizz
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2023
我喜歡玩《格裏姆洛克傳奇》。 該遊戲是一款第一人稱實时RPG遊戲，有一個有趣的轉捩點——你實際上扮演了四個不同的角色！ 故事開始於你的團隊被扔進格裡姆洛克山。 你發現自己身處一座陌生建築的頂層，而不是立即死於墜落。 你必須一層接一層地往下走，與怪物戰鬥，尋找寶藏，尋找秘密，最重要的是，生存下來。

遊戲在講故事和動作之間取得了平衡，因為你可以從之前經歷過這段旅程的人那裡找到筆記。 這些筆記為解决與主線任務相關的謎題提供了寶貴的提示。 他們還幫助完成支線任務，比如找到天樞之劍來完成戰士的挑戰（這兩個任務都不是完成遊戲所必需的）。

我向任何喜歡RPG和解謎的人推薦這款遊戲。

19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2014
Nous nous sommes rencontrés un jour de Novembre pluvieux. J'avais beaucoup entendu parler de lui, mais sans y prêter véritablement attention. Lui, ne me connaissait pas encore, mais a tout tenté pour me séduire. Il s'est mis à nu, a baissé son prix, m'attirant alors beaucoup plus dans ma cupidité... Comme j'étais jeune et ignorant.
Je me suis laissé porter par son univers, et en quelques instants, il était devenu une part indissociable de moi-même. A chaque nouvelle rencontre, je m'éverveillais de ses prouesses. J'étais heureux et amoureux.
Ces 19 heures passées à ses côtés furent délicieuses.
Et je compte bien y revenir, perçer tous ses mystères et le connaître dans les moindres détails.
 
Furvent
597 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
27.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Jogo focado em explorar tuneis e ele faz isso da melhor forma possivel. A sede de encontrar segredos faz com que cada parede seja vasculhada pacientimente, o mesmo de todos os cantos - Essa a melhor definição que podemos dar para o jogo.

O enredo é apenas plano de fundo, servindo apenas para intrigar a curiosidade. Seu singelo estilo de jogo não pode só ser considerado como nostalgia, ele é muito bom da forma que foi pensado. Há uma boa variedade de estratégias de combate com classes e armas diferentes, por mais que com o tempo você sinta que isso vai diminuindo. Há bons puzzles, alguns bem complicados outros bem simples, mas sempre com uma boa dose de equilibrio na dificuldade. Não tem trilha sonora notável, arte do jogo também - querendo ou não são paredes e alguns monstros mais ou menos, poderia ter mais classes e maior variedade de habilidades e modos de combate. Mas o que sinto mais falta no jogo são a possibilidade de ter uma tecla para atacar de cada personagem, é meio chato ter que ficar indo com o mouse em cada um principalmente quando você quer jogar mais jogado na cadeira ou mesmo no sofá, e claro mais magias. Juro que fiquei decepcionado quando notei que só tinhamos um punhado delas.

O jogo é daqueles que você não leva muito a sério no inicio, mas quando notas já se foram horas de gameplay. Bem de resto o jogo tem como defeito apenas a limitações de seu estilo, nada que não possa ser melhorado para a sequência, que não vejo a hora de experimentar.

В общем - классика дэнжонкраулеров. Рекомендую к прохождению!

Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2023
This is such a great game for anyone who loves old-style dungeons and dragons or other RPG's. It has that nostalgic feel of tabletop games but with decent graphics and sound. The dungeons and puzzles are beautifully conceived. Thrown into a dungeon to escape or die, 4 characters (you choose which!) must keep going and improve along the way, or die trying. It has a few difficulty levels, so it's good for anyone really. I heartily recommend!

thetick
689 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2021
Excellent dungeon crawler that maintains the old-school vibes while still completely modernizing the graphics, UI, and other features one might have expected in 2012 when this was released. In 2021, it still holds up quite well and was fun to play. While the graphics aren't flashy, they hold up really well. Controls are simple and make sense for the genre of game.

There are plenty of included maps and challenges to keep you busy for many, many hours. I think I maybe completed 50% of them. One of the best perks is that you can both create custom maps/challenges as well as play ones other players have built.

All-in-all, this game is an excellent deal when on sale. I wouldn't pay $15 for it though. I think that is over priced at this point given its age and that there are newer options available (not to mention Legend of Grimrock 2). I'd say a price of around $5 is pretty solid. Anything less is a great.
 
WONDERなパン
1,241 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2021
Legend of Grimrock is one of the best old school grid-based dungeon crawler RPGs ever! There is only one game that is better.... Legend of Grimrock II.

Exploration in this game is a lot of fun. There are a lot of puzzles, traps, secrets, hidden loot and challenging enemies. The game has nice sounds and beautiful graphics. It gives an eerie sort of atmosphere that fits the overall tone of the game very well.

I always felt nervous when I could hear the clinking of armor or footsteps nearby. Do I run into a trap or is there a hidden door? Or am I just paranoid and the enemy is farther away that I thought? Nope, he is behind me!

Don’t get cornered by enemies and always know you surroundings. Most of the time you can kite around enemies and kill them without getting hit.

There is a good amount of different classes and skills and creating a party of four people allows for variety of gamestyles. I had a lot of fun playing with a group of four mages!

For a more challenging experience you can disable the auto-mapping feature and draw the map manually instead. I would definitely recommend playing it this way at least once.
 
Inno
784 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
20.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 avril 2012
Here's how my journey with this game went. I hear about the game, I think "oh cripes an indie dungeon crawler, what crap."
Time goes on, hype builds up, and the game starts looking good. So I think to myself "Ok, maybe I will get this."
It gets released on Steam "Up until now there was no price on it, now it's $15? I'll wait for a Christmas sale."
April 17th "Jesus christ this is one of the most boring days of my life." I spend an hour contemplating just going ahead and getting Grimrock to cure my boredom. I eventually breakdown and buy it.

I open the game, go to the options, there is no volume slider.

This ♥♥♥♥ right here is why I have such intense hatred of indie games.
 
Four Bit Thug

Recommandé
31.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2021
ダンマスとの違いを挙げると、

勇者を復活させるなどは無くキャラクターを作ってからスタート
水のパラメータは存在しない
素振りや魔法使用による経験値取得が無い
キャラクターのレベルアップによってスキルポイントを取得し各スキルレベルを上げる

など結構違いはあるものの、謎解きも程よく（少々の英語知識必要・翻訳に頼ろう）クリア後も周回したくなるようなテンポの良いゲーム進行、心地良くプレイできる。

ダンジョンマスター好きな人は、無条件でおすすめ。

A képek, videók alapján nem értettem mi lehet olyan jó ebben a játékban, aztán egy Humble Bundle részeként megvettem, kipróbáltam és egy hétig képtelen voltam letenni. Egyszerűen magával ragadó a túlélésért folytatott klasszikus dungeon crawling, titkos ajtók, gombok, szintek. Fejtörők, ügyességi puzzle feladatok, rendkívül nehéz játékmenettel (ha van hely a mozgásra ne állj le szemtől szemben harcolni). Imádtam, beruháztam a második részre is.

Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2013
One of the best RPG I ever played. Don't be fooled by those screenshots: this game is deep and awesome, with exquisit level design and a powerful atmosphere. It takes the best all-time classic RPG ideas and improves the whole thing in a mix of real-time and turn-based gameplay. Board Game spirit with a high class european RPG body. Hero Quest + Skyrim.

Simply stunning! This game is what it is - an old-school dungeon crawler. Gameplay is reduced to it simplest expression. There are no conversations, no quests, no storyline. Just progress and survive, level up, manage inventories and abilities, and move on. That being said, this game is extremely fun, and keeps me coming back for more. 10/10

Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2013
Un gameplay oublié remit au goût du jour, Legend of Grimrock nous refait vivre ( ou decouvrir ) les années du 'dungeon Crawler'. Vous allez devoir gérer un groupe de 4 aventuriers à travers la prison de Grimrock afin de retrouver votre liberté.
Parcourir des salles de donjon, défaire des monstres, gagner des objets et resoudre des engnimes....
Ce jeu me plaît beaucoup et je pense que même avec son gameplay il n'aura pas de mal à trouver son public.

Recommandé
29.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2016
BEATEN!
Total playtime for playthrough - about 14 hours.
Classes chosen: 2 Minatour Melee/ 2 Wizards (ice/fire primarys)

Legends of Grimrock is a VERY old-school dungeon crawl experience. Tile-by-tile this game is tense and full of failure (but topped with rousing successes). It is hard but fun. It also, interestingly, includes a lot of environmental puzzles. On one or two occassions, the genre sorta made these a bit harder than they might otherwise be, but overall they are not an issue.

PROS:
- Old school dungeon crawling
- Character creation. Too many mixes to have them all.
- Good monster/level design
- A good challange
- Steam workshop! Even play new dungeons with existing characters.

♥♥♥♥:
- Some time-based puzzles can be annoying
- Can be a bit difficult for those impatient.
- No outdoor spaces (See LOG2)

Would certainly recommend
 
Oregono

Recommandé
31.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2014
시대는 돌고 돈다고 했던가?

플레이어를 바보로 아는가 싶을 정도로 과도한 수준의 유저 편의를 제공하는 시대에 부활한 불편함으로 가득찬 고전 스타일의 던전 RPG

중간중간 습득하는 쪽지들에 써있는 애매모호한 문구들과 꼼꼼이 살펴봐야 찾아낼 수 있는 그래픽상의 이질적인 부분들을 단서로 추리하고 탐색하며 던전 속의 비밀을 찾고 함정들을 돌파하는 고전적인 구성은 퀘스트 마커를 따라다니는 데 익숙해진 요즘이기에 도리어 신선하게 다가온다.

또한 맵 전체가 타일로 나뉘어져 한 칸 한 칸 이동하면서도 전투를 포함한 모든 것이 실시간으로 진행되기 때문에 긴박감이 느껴지면서도 적들이 이동하는 걸 보며 한 칸 한 칸 타일을 움직이다 보면 턴제 게임을 하는 듯한 오묘한 느낌을 받기도 한다.

다만 '허기'라는 개념이 있으면서도 식량이 생각 외로 넉넉하게 나오는 편이기 때문에 허기 때문에 특별히 고생하는 일도 없어 큰 존재감이 없다는 점, 또한 몇몇 퍼즐의 경우 힌트가 되는 문구가 지나치게 애매모호하게 써있기 때문에 퍼즐을 풀고 난 뒤에도 힌트가 무엇을 의미하는 건지 이해할 수 없다는 점이 단점으로 다가온다.

고전적인 던전 RPG에 향수가 있는 게이머에게도, 요즘의 RPG와 다른 색다른 맛을 느끼고 싶은 게이머에게도 어필할 수 있는 '즐거운 불편함'으로 가득찬 게임이다.
 
iGnisia

Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2017
I love this game, but be preapred to google about how a lot of how the mechanics work.
The tutorial is vague at best. And doesn't go into important details about properly attacking, magic usage, secret passageways, item handling, item stacking (How to unstack an item.) and various other things.
While the beginning is essentially a do it by trial and error tutorial, it's best to just google how the game works. I got stuck multiple times because of vague instructions and tutorial. It wouldn't be irritating if I was a vetren player that knew these things existed in Gimrock already. Though I'm someone who has had experience with these types of games before and I had significant trouble in the beginning,

Other than this one glaring issue at the beginning, once you know what you're doing you're good to go. The graphics are amazing, the gameplay is solid, the story; while simple, is interesting.
It's a solid game, but it's communication with the player could be improved.

Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2015
REALLY old school style of RPG here. Heck, you can grab yourself a sheet of grid paper and map out each dungeon if you want (or just let the computer do it for you)

No real story so to speak of, just move forward one square at a time RPG goodness with some incredibly infuriating puzzles thrown in along the way. Fight monsters, pick up loot, solve puzzles, find exit to next level, rinse, repeat.

It's 1993 all over again!

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
41.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2015
Legend of Grimrock I+II

Für alle die, die schon Dungeon Master und die Eye of the Beholder Reihe gut fanden, kann ich Legend of Grimrock nur sehr empfehlen. Man bewegt sich mit seiner Vierergruppe kästchenweise, wie damals, vorwärts und bekämpft diverse Monster und löst knifflige Dungeon-Rätsel. Es gibt interessante spielbare Rassen. Darunter Minotauren, Echsenmenschen, Rattenmenschen und sogar Insektenwesen neben den allbekannten Menschen. Klassische Rassen wie Elfen oder Zwerge wird man hier aber nicht finden. An Professionen gibt es das was man so aus RPGs kennt (Fighter, Knight, Barbarian, Wizzard, Battle-Mage, Alchemist, Rouge, und usw.). Man verteilt bei der Charaktererschaffung frei seine Attributspunkte und Skillpunkte und wählt noch zwei Traits (Vorteile). Die Magie funktioniert auch erfrischend anders, da man seine Zauber mittels Runen mit der Maus "malt" und diese dann zur Wirkung bringt. Die Charaktere müssen Nahrung zu sich nehmen, wobei Minotauren passenderweise mehr Nahrung benötigen als andere Rassen. Das Inventar kann man durch Säcke und Kisten erweitern und alles was man trägt hat natürlich auch ein Gewicht, so dass die Tragkraft sehr wichtig ist. Mittels pflanzlicher Zutaten kann man Tränke brauen. Die Rätsel sind sehr knifflig und nutzen jede nur erdenkliche Interaktionsmöglichkeit im Spiel und richtet sich an echte Dungeonmaster. Nach und nach sammelt man immer bessere Ausrüstung und Artefakte die man sich aber schwer verdienen muss. Geworfene oder geschossene Projektile kann man wieder aufsammeln und findet diese auch nur sehr spärlich. Türen und Truhen benötigen oft Schlüssel oder Dietriche und erstere sind oft auch wieder verschließbar so dass man in Ruhe rasten kann, was aber wiederum den Hunger ansteigen lässt. Die Soundeffekte gefallen mir sehr gut und man hört auch die umherziehenden Monster. Es gibt viele unterschiedliche Arten von Fallen, darunter auch die guten alten Fallgruben in die man schreiend hinabstürzen kann, inklusive gebrochener Beine und dergleichen. Neben normalen Verletzungen, die nur den LE-Balken reduzieren gibt es auch schwerere Wunden bzw. Brüche, die man durch gewöhnliches Rasten nicht mehr heilen kann sondern Heiltränke dafür benötigt. Gewöhnliche Heilzauber scheint es absichtlich nicht zu geben, so dass die Rast sehr wichtig ist, bei der man auch von streunenden Monster überrascht werden kann, wenn man seinen Rastplatz schlecht auswählt. Licht ist sehr wichtig, da man im Dunkeln kaum noch was erkennt.
Pech♥♥♥♥eln, die natürlich abbrennen, bieten hier ein anderes Licht als magisches, welches auch unter Wasser von Nutzen ist, da man dort noch weniger sieht. Man muss sehr genau abwägen, wer welche gefundenen Artefakte bekommt und welche Skills man steigert. Letztere sind natürlich nicht zurücksetzbar wie sich das in einem oldschool CRPG auch gehört.

Im ersten Teil ist man so zu sagen nur in Dungeons und erst im zweiten Teil gibt es dann auch eine Oberfläche und auch einen Tag- und Nachtwechsel. Beide Teile kann man unabhängig von einander spielen und sind von der Technik her im Grunde gleich.

Das Spiel ist nur auf Englisch erhältlich (da es aber nur sehr wenig Texte gibt, sollte das kein Problem sein). Womit wir auch beim größten Manko des Spiels sind: es hat im Grunde so gut wie keine Storry. Wen das aber nicht stört und sich mal wieder an die "guten alten Zeiten" zurückerinnern will, sollte diese beide Dungeoncrawler mal ausprobieren.

Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner Gruppe.
 
Dark-Chummer
2
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2018
Super fun dungeon crawler styled old school. However, this does lead to a clunky UI and tile based movement. The tile based movement would be fine if the games puzzles didn't require speed. Monster AI is also a bit lacking in that you can kill virtually everything by strafing constantly and stabbing. This game redeems itself through its puzzles and secrets that reward you for thoroughly exploring each level. If you're not getting a sense of accomplishment in your actual life, just play this game.
 
Anatha
349 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
39.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2012
Les plus :

- Le seul et unique Dungeon Crawler moderne. Un effet "madeleine de Proust" instantané pour les vieillards !
- Très finement réalisé. Les monstres en particulier sont très bien animés et l'ambiance restitue parfaitement l'atmosphère si particulière des ancients dungeon crawlers.
- Un level design aux petits ognons, avec des tas de passages secrets, de boutons cachés, de trapes dissimulées. Un vrai plaisir de fouiner chaque recoin.
- Une difficulté très bien dosée.
- Des enigmes globalement très bien pensées.

Les moins :

- Si l'on compare aux grands titres du genre, il manque une certaine envergure "fantastique" à Legend of Grimrock. Le fait de n'enchaîner qu'une multitude de niveaux sur un plan vertical fait que l'on ne ressent jamais une possibilité, une surprise. Dungeon Master 2, par exemple, developpait tout une partie dans des jardins, partie inquiétante et maussade, qui apportait une ambiance tout à fait différente. Le principal défaut de Legend of Grimrock repose dans son manque de renouvellement au niveau de ses atmosphères.
- Pas de scénario (enfin, juste un semblant de)
- Pas de vendeurs, de NPC. Les intéractions avec l'univers sont minimalistes si l'on compare aux cadors du genre.

Je ne peux que recommander ce jeu, surtout lorsqu'aucune alternative moderne n'existe. Legend of Grimrock est un Dungeon Crawler qui repose plus sur la finesse de son gameplay, de ses enigmes et secrets, que sur l'envie de surprendre le joueur. L'univers est donc limité en ambiances et intéractions, mais très riche en terme d'expérience de jeu.
 
Sira

Kangarw Jesus
284 produits enregistrés
2
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2018
Legend of Grimrock is a game that I honestly didn't expect to find nowadays. It's reminiscent of an ancient genre of game that seemed dead long ago. But fear not; this is a modern vision of the dungeon crawler genre while still maintaining it's old scool foundations.

Just a note. The people saying that this game is too hard... do not take them seriously. This game may be hard for today's standarts because everyone is now used to have the game put everything in their face and reduce the thinking to a minimum. It's like the game is playing you instead of you playing the game. LOG doesn't do that.
To be frank I thought the riddles were all fairly easy to solve while a couple of them were definitely challenging and demanding, taking up many minutes or even hours to figure out what to do. I'm talking about the story related riddles. There are a lot of secret rooms and optional paths to search and these yes, are really hard to find, but they aren't required to progress, as they only grant you with better gear or handy stuff.

The atmosphere is so good! You are always on the edge. If you ask me the feeling of having nowhere to go but down is creepy enough to make you want to progress. The sense of dread and mystery is so intense. The thought of "what will I find in the next floor?" washes over you. Because of this I found LOG highly immersive. This game actually suceeds to make you think you're one of the prisioners encased in the dungeon, fighting to escape the dungeon against creatures more bizarre than the previous ones you've encountered. Also the feeling of rewardness you get by solving a riddle or finding a secret passage by yourself is huge.

I got so hooked on LOG that I beat the game in a little more than four days (in the exams week), always asking for one more floor. For me this game could have 50 floors that I would still be playing and asking for more. I bought the sequel yesterday after beating the game but before playing it I'm doing a second playtrought to find what I've missed in the first run.

If you like RPG and dungeon crawl do not miss the chance, it's the finest you can get. LOG truly respects the legacy of dungeon crawlers and puzzle games. Congratulations to the team of four people that brought LOG to us.
 
Revenge

Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2012
まんま往年のダンジョンマスター。しかし60fpsで描写されるスムースな移動と、洗練され必要なものを必要最小限にまとめたインターフェースでプレイするとこんなにも楽しいものかと感動する。

四方向移動、旋回しかできないパーティを操作してリアルタイムに行う戦闘は若干の慣れが必要だと思うが、敵の側面や背後に回りこみつつ斬りつけ、ルーンを組み立て魔法を唱えながら戦うシステムは非常にエキサイティング。

ダンジョンのギミックも陰湿さの無いアメリカンな構成で好感が持てる。
ただダンジョンは謎解きをメインに構成されており、敵とガシガシ戦いたいという期待には応えてくれない。
