( ) Pessoas que conhecem a morte

--Texturas, Gráficos, Lindeza?
( ) Parece com os gráficos dos jogos do Atari
( ) 220 x 120p
(x) Meia boca, tem piores
( ) Dentro da média atual
( ) Quase um The Witcher 3
( ) The witcher 3
( ) Isso veio de outra dimensão

--Falhas
( ) Isso é uma falha
( ) Bug pra todo lado, tipo tiro em favela no Rio
( ) Muita falha mas dá pra jogar
( ) Bugs que são legais e não atrapalham
(x) Sem grandes falhas
( ) Esse jogo saiu perfeito do forno

--É difícil?
( ) Basta assisitr o jogo
( ) Zera com uma guitarra
( ) Pega logo as manha, mas sempre normal
(x) Bem desafiador, as vezes difícil
( ) Parece Dark Souls
( ) Equiparável a Dark Souls
( ) É necessário morrer (de verdade) pra zerar

--Quanto tempo pra acabar Sapoha
( ) Você acaba antes de sair do menu
( ) Tempo necessário pra cantar Faroeste Caboclo
(x) Tempo de jogo dos jogos exclusivos da sony
( ) Muito tempo, no minimo umas 40 horas
( ) Skyrim da vida
( ) Praticamente um MMORPG

--Tem uma história?
( ) Não, um Pubg da vida
( ) tem história só pra não dizer que não tem
(x) Dá pra gostar da história, se esforçando
( ) Consegue te arrancar uma lágrima ou duas
( ) Nivel The Last Of Us
( ) Dava pra fazer um livro nivel Harry Potter
( ) Deveria constar no curriculo do Ensino médio

--Audio, músicas
( ) Nivel do Funk Brasilero
( ) Jogue mutado
( ) Dá pra escutar
(x) Legalzinho
( ) Os caras capricharam no áudio
( ) Baixe a play list pra escutar no ônibus
( ) Toque o tema no seu casamento

--Trambolho necessário pra rodar
( ) Nokia 1995
(x) Um PC com uma placa de vídeo do tempo da vovó

( ) Um PC já considerado gamer
( ) Invista no minimo 4k em hardware
( ) SLI de 1080ti
( ) Esqueça, a tecnologia atual não dá conta

--Vale a pena o investimento?
( )Pedi até refund
( )Ainda bem que foi presente
( )Melhor ter comprado um pastel
(x)Se pagou
( )Pagaria o dobro
( )Vale mais que o resto dos meus jogos juntos.

Nota final: 8/10

Recommandé
29.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2018
Um RPG old school bem fiel às raízes, porém com bons gráficos e boa jogabilidade. O jogo diverte e apesar de ser um indie, não leva menos do que 20 horas para se completar, o que é algo bem agradável.

Destaque para a personalização de habilidades e para as diferentes classes, assim como também para a interação dos puzzles com a história do jogo. Recomendado!

Para os caçadores de conquistas: este é um prato cheio para quem gosta do gênero!
 
Killdrax
2,342 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
54.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2017
An excellent crawler RPG. It is also very well balanced. I never felt like I was fighting the game system, unlike a number of other RPGs I have played and no grinding is needed. The challenge at normal is just right even though I ran out of patience and gave up on a number of secrets and achievements. I reccommend this game for RPG fans, puzzle fans, and those looking for a nostalgia itch of dungeon crawling RPGs of the early days of PC gaming.

zappeo

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2016
Un jeu qui a cherché à renouer avec une certaine idée du Dungeon Crawling à l'ancienne.
Comme dans les classiques, vous sélectionnez votre équipe de 4 persos, les crées de toute pièces, et au fur et à mesure que vous vous enfoncez dans le donjon, c'est porte/monstre/trésor, avec gestion de l'inventaire, des montées de niveau, de la fatigue et de la faim.

A noter que ce premier opus se focalise beaucoup sur les puzzles et énigmes et que les combats restent assez basiques voire répétitifs. De plus vous ne sortez jamais à l'air libre, claustrophobes s'abstenir.

Gros plus pour les artisans : vous avez droit à un éditeur de niveau, et beaucoup de choses sont à récupérer sur le workshop, la communauté y est plutôt active.

Conclusion : pour les nostalgiques du donjonaje à l'ancienne.
 
Letho Kanes
157 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2012
Do not underestimate this game: it is tough. Even on easy, the puzzles become daunting, the monsters brutal, and your party's resources frighteningly scarce. If you're not careful to level up your characters efficiently right out of the gates you'll find yourself trapped in grinding mode until you're able to progress...but be warned: your food dwindles at an alarming rate and is every bit as elusive as any other form of aid. It's a no-joke type situation, and a person would do well to get into this with the mindset of committing to a hardcore adventure.

Nonetheless, I find the challenge a good thing. It's refreshing to have to think in a video game again and quite rewarding when you manage to proceed to another floor. You can spend a huge amount of time playing this game too--plenty of levels, lots of achievements, tons of brain teasing puzzles, plenty of weapons and gear to scavenge and disburse amongst your characters. While not for the faint of heart, this game gets my thumbs-up.
 
Sir Tedrick
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2012
Ok, so you remember the old-school first-person dungeon crawlers? It's one of those, and it's excellent.

Oh, wait, you said "no"? Oh, well, let me break it down for you. It's an RPG with light story, grid-based movement, puzzles and exploration a-plenty, and monsters intent on ruining your day at every turn. You know The Elder Scrolls? It's not like that. You don't go on quests, you don't visit towns, you don't save the world. You get one massive dungeon that you and your party of four wander through in a ceaseless battle for survival and escape. The game is hard for the modern gamer. It requires careful planning, strategy, and knowing a few things about RPGs (fire wrecks undead, poison is wasted on spiders, etc.), but every battle is rewarding.

If you want something old (or something new, depending on your gaming history), grab this. It's incredible, and there's the promise of custom dungeons on the horizon, so you'll have plenty more exploring to do in the future. Good luck.
 
*Furious Train Whistling*

Facilmente um dos RPGs eletrônicos que mais gostei de jogar, o jogo apresenta diversos elementos presentes no RPG de mesa, além disso, ele se torna extremamente desafiador conforme se avança na dungeon, a cada andar os puzzles e inimigos se tornam mais difíceis e exigem mais do seu raciocínio, a história se desenrola lentamente, mas te deixa aflito para descobrir o que está acontecendo e o que vai acontecer, recomendo para todos que amam RPGs e puzzles.

65.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2014
昔懐かしのダンジョンマスターに似た3Dダンジョン探索ゲーム。
飽くまでも「似ている」だけなので、「ここが本家と違う！」「こんなのダンマスじゃねえ！」という面が多々あるかもしれないが
だからこそ「似ている」ゲームなのでそこはプレイヤーが寛容的になってむしろ楽しむべきだろう。
基本的に難易度や謎解きは比較的緩く、ダンジョンマスターをプレイしたことのないプレイヤーが入門程度にプレイするには丁度良いといえる。
ワークショップもなかなか充実しており、バニラに飽きても安心してプレイ出来るところが大変有り難い・・・

Great 'Old School' feel to this RPG dungeon crawler. Little to no hand holding, meaning you are free to explore and learn like any good game should let you do. Tactical combat, some decent puzzles and the ability to level up and gear out your characters make the game all the more interesting and certainly worth your time!

921 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
25.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2016
The first levels are thrilling. It was my childhood's "Eye of the Beholder" all over again, oh boy! Then the flaws started to creep out.

First, as you progress you'll find out that dancing around is a necessity to survive battles. No matter how good your builds are, you characters just can't take hits. That's so hugely silly. Just picture that party of four misfits madly sidestepping around.

Which brings us to the stats system. Some attributes' effects are nonsensical and unbalanced. As a result, optimal builds are ridiculous. End game heavy armor on a minotaur will never equal in survivability to puny rogue with evade investement. Heavy axes never equal the devastating power of thrown weapons on a minotaur with nil investment in dexterity.

Lastly, the puzzles are obtuse, arbitrary and frustrating.

I don't really understand all the glowing reviews. I'm still hoping to find a good old enjoyable dungeon crawler.
 
grillonbleu

Évaluation publiée le 10 décembre 2013
First of all, I would like to say this is an amazing game. Why? Good graphics, very dark, simple but sometimes hard puzzles, and an unique type of combat and movement. If you have a fear of spiders I would not recommend this game because the spiders in this game are huge compared to normal ones you might see daily.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
80.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2014
Details
How Dungeon Master should be remade.
Legend of Grimrock 
Une capture d'écran de Legend of Grimrock
Par : boyflea

The game has bags of charm and some really good dungeon design. The team who built this were dedicated 'Dungeon Master' fanatics and it shows. The in-combat system has flaws; difficult to take potions and swap weapons in-combat - which are addressed in mods and the sequel. Solid gameplay, hours of fun, some really creative achievements as well. The online community also took on the challenge of expanding the world, as the built-in editor is a Dm's dream! Supports lua scripting for you modders out there too.
Summary
A truly wonderful experience and one for all you old DM fans out there!
Pros:
- it's Dungeon Master for the Millenials (or something)
- you can all build your own dungeons
- it's a great level design
- it has a lot of cool achievements

♥♥♥♥:
- that bloody puzzle midway, boo!
- some fiddly controls when in-battle (which modders then fixed)
9/10 - SUPERB 
Création de la communauté pour Steam Artwork
Par : boyflea
An innovative game you will love and replay.
